Forum Post: 
Post title: SQL returns boolean?
Post description: G'day all, I'm attempting to move a large SQL report-generating query from Ad-Hoc Reports into a cron job, but am butting my head trying to get even the simplest query to work properly. For some reason, any queries I add, as per following, return a "1", aka var_dump of "bool(true)", despite the queries working fine in phpmyadmin? A few things to note; this is added to the end of an existing lib.php triggered by cron, which contains another sql query which works fine - is this an issue?  Other sql uses $DB->get_recordset_select. Here's a simple example; am I doing something stupidly wrong? 
```text
$sqlreport = "SELECT
 c.shortname AS 'Course ID' FROM {course} c";


$reportresults = $DB->execute($sqlreport);


mtrace($reportresults);


var_dump($reportresults);


file_put_contents($reportfile, $reportresults, FILE_APPEND); //create report file
```
 It seems that "execute()" is the correct method to use for arbitrary queries? The above returns the following in phpmyadmin (with the prefix in place) 
```text
Course ID


E247


E248


testSite


SW01


SW02
```

Post title: Artificial context object for testing?
Post description: I started this post by describing a particular problem I'm having, but realized that what would be more valuable to me is a more general troubleshooting tool. I frequently find myself asking "what is this function/method returning?", and I can't just create a quick CLI test script because it takes a context object as an argument. I can't be the first person who's had this problem, so I wonder: does there exist a way to just say "create a context object for me as if I was logged in as user X and look at module Y"? If there's no such thing, do people have any other advice for investigating those long chains where X calls Y, which calls Z, which calls... and somewhere along the way something unexpected is happening? Thanks!

Forum Post: 
Post title: How to crash MS Edge in one easy step
Post description: Last week, I received a somewhat puzzling report from a user who claimed that he couldn't open files from Moodle in Microsoft Edge.  Upon further investigation, I was able to determine that the trouble was with PDF files displaying embedded in the page: when you open one, Edge stops responding to user input.  You can scroll the page (but not the PDF) - but nothing else; no UI element within Edge will work, and clicking on links does nothing (except occasionally highlight the link).  If you have multiple tabs open and still have it set to warn when closing multiple tabs, attempting to close it via right-click on the taskbar button will pop up that confirmation box - but you can't interact with that, either!  The quickest way to kill Edge when it's in this state seems to be to drag the titlebar down to the bottom of the screen, though you can also use other methods such as ending the task in Task Manager. I was eventually able to track it down to Moodle's embed maximiser script (which resizes the embed to take up as much space as possible on the page).  That script sets the height and width of the embed to 0px briefly, so it can check the size of the page without it present; for some reason, this specific act puts Edge into the strange state where it refuses all input.  I've submitted a patch which instead uses display:none to make the embed take up no space while it calculates - MDL-51190 - which is currently awaiting peer review, but thought I'd post here in case anyone else has been scratching their heads over this issue.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Code freeze for 2.9 starts Mon 6 Apr
Post description: Hi, all. This message is to provide notice to developers about the impending code-freeze starting on Monday 6 April. The code freeze is a point after which no new code (only fixes to
existing code) is accepted until beyond the release. This stabilisation
allows for QA testing and means developers are able to respond rapidly
to bugs found. For more information see... http://docs.moodle.org/dev/Process#Events_during_cycle Thanks to all the contributors to Moodle 2.9. We are waiting until all new features land in product and will prepare the release notes page from this list of issues .

Post title: Programatically restore forum activity from backup file
Post description: Hi, I need to programatically back up and restore a forum activity. I am trying to follow the restore process described here https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Restore_2.0_for_developers#Automatically_triggering_restore_in_code but I am getting errors. I have my backup file in $CFG-> dataroot . '/temp/backup/test/' named backup123.mbz, and I want to restore it into course id 456, so I am doing: 
```text
$folder             = '/test/'; // as found in: $CFG->dataroot . '/temp/backup/'


$courseid         = '456'; // 


$user_doing_the_backup   = 2; // e.g. 2 == admin


// Restore backup into course.


$controller = new restore_controller($folder, $courseid,


        backup::INTERACTIVE_NO, backup::MODE_SAMESITE, $user_doing_the_backup,


        backup::TARGET_EXISTING_ADDING);


$controller->execute_precheck();


$controller->execute_plan();
```
 I am not sure what to use if I am trying to restore into an existing course, so I go with TARGET_EXISTING_ADDING, I have tried all other options as well (TARGET_CURRENT_DELETING, TARGET_CURRENT_ADDING, TARGET_EXISTING_DELETING, TARGET_EXISTING_ADDING) but all produce the same error. For the folder i tried 'test' and 'test/' and '/test/' and tried adding the exact backup file name as well, all produce the same error. In fact, even if I use the code as it is straight out of the link above and try to restore my activity into a new course (as is the case in the link) I still get the exact same error which is: 
```text
Default exception handler: error/cannot_precheck_wrong_status Debug: 


Error code: cannot_precheck_wrong_status


$a contents: 200
```
 Someone here https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=347629 had the same error however I cannot message them or comment on that post to find out the exact solution. Someone here https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=350138 seems to be doing it successfully, I have tried using literally their code, still getting the error above. Any help is greatly appreciated.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Error code: storedfilecannotread
Post description: I did something silly and wanted to share the fix in case someone else did the same thing. When you upload a file (e.g a scorm package) in Moodle through the UI it uses the Moodle file api to store it in moodledata/filedir and point to it in the moodle database table mdl_files. What I did was accidentally delete half of the filedir directory. The person who is responsible for backups realized after I did this that they had no backups. So when you clicked on a scorm activity link, for example, in the course you would see the following error: More information about this error Debug info: [ dataroot ]/filedir/ff/d9/ffd980468bb9a9d42e24991891182efb973eba94 Error code: storedfilecannotread Stack trace: line 454 of /lib/filestorage/stored_file.php: file_exception thrown line 2127 of /lib/filelib.php: call to stored_file->readfile() line 2491 of /lib/filelib.php: call to readfile_accel() line 1005 of /mod/scorm/lib.php: call to send_stored_file() line 4601 of /lib/filelib.php: call to scorm_pluginfile() line 37 of /pluginfile.php: call to file_pluginfile() We had the scorm files though. And so to fix this problem you should access the Moodle database and issue the following command (this sql is just for the scorm file fix): delete from mdl_files where contextid=(SELECT id FROM `mdl_context` WHERE instanceid=(SELECT id FROM `mdl_course_modules` where course=20 and module=18 and instance = (select id from mdl_scorm where name='[name of scorm activity]'))) just subsitute "name of scorm activity" with whatever that activity is named in teh course or database . . . "Module 1" for example. This deletes all the previously associated files in the file system associated with that scorm activity/contextid. Then you just turn on editing in the Moodle UI and re-upload the scorm package for the given activity. Then the link will work again. So this is how i rebuilt the filedir. Of course as I said above this is just for the scorms we had. If you uploaded anything else throught he Moodle UI it would be in the filedir too and therefore be broken.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Unit testing Messaging, database environment not resetting between tests.
Post description: I'm working on writing a bunch of unit tests for an existing custom body of work (which I've talked extensively about distributing before, to a fairly cold response). So far, the tests have been going OK - but I've written some tests to make sure event observers were being called correctly, and this is where things are falling over. When this specific action I'm testing occurs, it generates a notification to the staff and student using the messaging system to state that the action occurred. Two scenarios can occur; One for an instance of an Assign module and one for an instance of a Quiz module. My tests are structured that they extend a base test class which contains setup/teardown code. In setUp() the course used for the test is setup, staff and students are added correctly (they have their own assertions which are all passing as expected), Groups and Groupings are added (again, checked with assertions). In tearDown() the variables are unset to hopefully prevent these staying around. In the test themselves, they are essentially duplicated. Test 1 creates an Assignment module instance, assigns the grouping to the module instance and sets other basic information such as the due date etc (all checked with assertions). We then apply the extension (this is our custom code, not the core extensions which are not very advanced) to a group inside the grouping, this all works OK (all assertions pass), the event is called (assertions for this pass too) and the observer picks up and calls the required code to generate the message. In this test, this passes all assertions correctly. Test 2 does the same process as Test 1, with the required changes to create a Quiz module instance rather than an Assignment module. Everything passes all assertions until the Message is generated - for, get this, the Assignment module instance created in the previous test! The module instance created in Test 1 and Test 2 both end up with the same Course Module ID! It's like the whole environment isn't being reset between tests. In each test that is testing the observer and messaging, I've tried calling $this->preventResetByRollback(); as I've seen in other tests - but no change. I've tried with and without $this->preventResetByRollback() with no change. I can switch the order of these tests and whichever is run last fails as it's using the module created by the previous test. I can comment out either of the tests and on their own they both run successfully. I can comment out all other tests (three others, no messaging stuff), same result. I am rebuilding the course cache at the top of each test, again after the module instance is created, and then again at the end of the test itself. I have confirmed Setup/Teardown are being executed before and after each test: 
```text
Moodle 2.9.2+ (Build: 20150924), pg
sql


PHPUnit 3.7.38 by Sebastian Bergmann.



Configuration read from C:\moodle\my_phpunit.
xml


.Setup called Setup complete. Tear down calledTeardown complete


..................Setup called Setup complete. Running test_quiz_global_extension_observer


Tear down calledTeardown complete


FSetup called Setup complete. Running test_assign_global_extension_observer


Tear down calledTeardown complete


.Setup called Setup complete. Tear down calledTeardown complete


.Setup called Setup complete. Tear down calledTeardown complete


.Setup called Setup complete. Tear down calledTeardown complete


.Setup called Setup complete. Tear down calledTeardown complete
```
 Admittedly I'm new to unit testing so probably missing something obvious - but to me it appears that despite setUp and tearDown being called at the correct locations (before and after each test) that the environment isn't being reset. Not sure where to go to resolve this, any help appreciated.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Potentially breaking YUI changes in today's master, test your plugins now!
Post description: Hi All, In the slow march towards weaning ourselves off YUI, i've just removed the mcore YUI rollup from being included on every single Moodle page ( MDL-57690 ). This was including a few Moodle YUI modules unconditionally all the time (dock loader, popup help, and widget/dialogue modules) and so if you are using of any of these modules without explicitly declaring the dependency it may not have been detected before. Now that those modules are not being included unconditionally your code may break. It would be a good time to test your plugins early against master this week using boost. Or grep your code for instances of `M.core.dialogue` (which was the main thing we detected undeclared dependencies in core code).

Forum Post: 
Post title: Seeking a "show/save aribtrary input data" plugin
Post description: Greetings-- I am a software developer who is brand new to Moodle, and fairly new to PHP (though I've done extensive server -side scripting with other technologies, mostly ASP/VBscript/ SQL Server).  As such, I'm still wading through the Moodle docs , so please excuse me (and correct me) if I misuse the terminology; and please advise me if posts like this belong in a different forum. We have been charged with finding, or building, a plugin that provides functionality like this: Content creator generates an activity that looks mostly like an HTML page, except it includes specially coded spaces (text inputs) in which student can enter data, which is saved.  (At this point, it's reminiscent of an "Embedded Answer (Cloze)" quiz question; but it's not quite the same thing.) Content creator may create several such activities .  The "identifier" for a text item in one activity may match an identifier for a text item in a different activity.  In such a case, any text the user may have previously entered, matching that "identifier", in this or ANY OTHER similar activity, will populate the field. Content creator may specify an instance of a field to be "read-only", in which case student's previously-entered value will just show up (in that activity) as inline text, not as a text entry box. Student may edit the values in the text fields at any time (except in activities where they're marked as read-only). Content creator will define the unique names for the field identifiers (subject to some syntax restrictions TBD). If possible, we would like the student's entered values to be preserved across courses, so that an activity of this type in course "B" may be populated with the values that the student entered while in course "A".  In this sense, the entered values are somewhat like pieces of the student's "profile". Does anyone know of an existing plugin that works this way? Thanks! - Rick

Post title: $DB->update_record appears to be dropping columns
Post description: Good afternoon all, A quick bit of background, I've been a PHP developer for a few years, this is the first time I've worked on a Moodle site, everything seems to be going well but I have an issue with one of my database fields. I have a database table with a number of columns, most of which are populated upon creation, a few of which are populated when the item has been looked at by the appropriate person. To clarify in the test process of this I've examined the stdClass immediately before it is parsed to the update_record and insert_record methods and all of the fields are set to the values I would expect. Any advice or guidance on this would be great - I'm really stuck now and just can't understand why it isn't working Many thanks in advance! Matt

Post title: Get students on activity
Post description: Hi, I'm trying to get a list of students on a course activity (it's supposed to support any activity/module that can be installed) Initially I was just going to get the activity, find out what course it is on, then find all the students on that course, but I realised that doesn't take into account where it has been restricted to specific groups/groupings. Having a look at some of the mods, the "assign" mod has a method called count_participants (and list_participants ), which does take that into account and only gets the participants who should actually be on the activity, but that is just a method on that assign class so could only be used for that 1 mod. Whereas then looking at something like turnitintooltwo, that doesn't seem to really take the restrict access into account, as the student list in the submission inbox still shows all the students, regardless of group. And whilst other mods might have something similar, they are all their own separate methods in their own classes, which would make the supporting of any module/activity quite difficult. So... is there any kind of built in method or function in Moodle which I can use to find only the students who should actually be on a given activity/module? Or will I need to write one for that? Cheers.

Post title: LDAP Sync - users can't log in when script is running because it blocks writes to mdl_user
Post description: I am keen to address the issue that others have had with the LDAP sync job (e.g. https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=278900 ). Has anyone developed a fix for this? I would like to try Eseosa's suggestion in the above thread: "I find running transaction in batches help alleviate issue. ../auth/ldap/auth.php Using $xcount as counter - if X records, commit transaction and restart new transaction. So far, no deadlocks detected on system." If anyone else has gone ahead with this, it would be great to know: 1. How large are the batches in which transactions are committed (how many users should be processed per commit). 2. Which stage of the sync job is causing the issue. I haven't looked into this yet -  I will need to find out which of the two transactions needs to be managed in batches in this way. Thanks!

When user responds to the question in Flash, I want to mark whether the response was correct or not. The flash file knows whether response was right or not. I am just wondering where do I mark this in Moodle database. To get to the bottom, I tried the following: - Created a new quiz with one numerical question. - The numerical question has 3 possible answers (10,20,30). Grade is set to 100% for Answer "20" - I attempted the quiz with right response (i.e. "20"). So far all is good. - Now while reviewing the quiz, I tried to change some values in the database directly, to make answer "30" the correct answer. - I changed "rightanswer" column in "question_attempts" table, changed "fraction" column value in "question_answers" table to make answer "30" correct answer. But still when I review the question in my quiz attempt, at the bottom it still says: "The correct answer is: 20". I don't know where it gets this "20" as correct answer. I tried to run the My Sql trace while updating the question but cannot find any clue. Can somebody please point me in the right direction. Thanks.

Post title: Code freeze starts Mon 6 Oct
Post description: Hi, all. This message is to provide notice to developers about the impending code-freeze starting on Monday 6 October. The code freeze is a point after which no new code (only fixes to
existing code) is accepted until beyond the release. This stabilisation
allows for QA testing and means developers are able to respond rapidly
to bugs found. For more information see... http://docs.moodle.org/dev/Process#Events_during_cycle

Forum Post: 
Post title: Removal of calendar_event_hook()
Post description: This hook (specified in https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Calendar_API#Event_hook ) is being removed in 3.3 by MDL-57578 . This hook was added without much explanation. Developers should be using the Moodle events system to achieve this behaviour, not use this hacky calendar specific implementation. Events will be added in MDL-55611 for 3.3 which you can use if you wish to be notified of the hide/show calender event action.

Post title: Activate enrollment plugin on all courses
Post description: We have a plugin in development which will need to be activated across all courses and forced to be used on all courses without the ability to delete. Our developer is looking into it and may have a solution but if we release this plugin we were hoping there was a way to do it within Moodle itself instead of hacking the database . Is there an easy way that we don't know about to ensure the plugin is global on all courses and cannot be deleted? I should point out this plugin operates completely separate of all other enrollment plugins so you can still do self-enroll, manual, cohort, etc. Our plugin generates 6 digit unique codes for every course and group on a site.  When the code is entered on a form on the homepage the student is instantly enrolled into the corresponding course/group.  Our amazing developer took it a step further and has integrated a QR CODE reader into the form which will allow the student to hold up a printed qr code into the camera on a chromebook and instantly be enrolled into the course as well.  This is tremendously important for K-12 sites where you have hundreds of courses and 6 year olds trying to navigate around to find a proper course.

Post title: SQL Query help - Configurable Reports
Post description: I am running this query to check for users who have not accessed their enrolled courses for more than 30 days. The report is suppose to return the courses they are enrolled into, the groups and the last time they accessed the course: SELECT DISTINCT user2.id AS ID, user2.firstname AS Firstname, user2.lastname AS Lastname, user2.email AS Email, user2.city AS City, user2.phone1 AS Phone, c.fullname AS Course, g.name AS Groupname, FROM_UNIXTIME(ue.timestart,'%D %M %Y') AS CourseEnrolmentDate ,(SELECT r.name FROM  prefix_user_enrolments AS uenrol JOIN prefix_enrol AS e ON e.id = uenrol.enrolid JOIN prefix_role AS r ON e.id = r.id AND r.shortname='student' WHERE uenrol.userid=user2.id AND e.courseid = c.id) AS RoleName FROM prefix_user_enrolments AS ue JOIN prefix_enrol AS e ON e.id = ue.enrolid JOIN prefix_groups AS g JOIN prefix_groups_members AS m ON g.id = m.groupid JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c.id = e.courseid JOIN prefix_user AS user2 ON user2.id = ue.userid AND m.userid = user2.id LEFT JOIN prefix_user_lastaccess AS ul ON ul.userid = user2.id WHERE (c.id=34 or c.id=35) AND DATEDIFF( NOW(),FROM_UNIXTIME(ul.timeaccess) ) > 30 AND e.status = 0 AND user2.suspended = 0 AND user2.deleted = 0 AND ue.status=0 AND DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(ue.timeend),'%Y/%m/%d') >=NOW() ORDER BY ID, Course ASC It is also suppose to check if their course is still active. I am getting double up on the records because some users have more than one group per course. Does anyone know how to fix this?

Post title: SQL: Dynamic table names for course modules in a sql query
Post description: I'm not sure if this is possible. I am trying to improve a BI Dashboard plugin I have made, trying to minimise the amount of processing power and DB calls it makes. Currently to get the activity instance record I do this 
```text
$
sql
 = "SELECT cm.id, cm.instance, m.name 


 FROM {course_modules} cm


 INNER JOIN {modules} m ON m.id = cm.module


 WHERE m.name <> 'label' AND cm.id IN (".$course_activities.")";

$course_modules = $DB->get_records_sql($sql, null);

foreach ($course_modules as $cmkey => $course_module) {

    $activity_instance = $DB->get_record($course_module->name, array('id'=>$course_module->instance));
.....
.....
}
```
 Is there a way that I can include the activity instance in the first query. ie. Something like: 
```text
$sql = "SELECT cm.id, cm.instance, m.name, a.name


FROM {course_modules} cm


INNER JOIN {modules} m ON m.id = cm.module


INNER JOIN {m.name} a ON a.id = cm.instance


WHERE m.name <> 'label' AND cm.id IN (".$course_activities.")";
```

Forum Post: 
Post title: HEADS UP: Additional one week delay for 3.2 release
Post description: New Bootstrap4-based theme called "BOOST" that we are introducing in
3.2 has really shaken look of Moodle and organisation of navigation (in a
good way!). At the same time we are still finding little visual or
functional problems and we would really like to fix them before the
release. Developers and testers are already welcome to download Moodle 3.2RC2 from either download page or official GIT repository or it's mirror on github . However
we do not feel confident yet that Moodle 3.2 will be ready for
production by the end of this week and we want to move the release date
to 5 December 2016 . We appreciate your patience and hope that you will welcome all the hard work of our developers.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Removing the Dashboard
Post description: Hello, I want to gain more control over the drawer, and right drop down menu. My current solution is a hack, and I'd appreciate some guidance to ensure it's done right. It all started with just trying to hide ' Dashboard ' from the menus. However, I've also decided to remove calendar and private files (add_front_page_course_essentials). I was hoping to use a mustache template, anytime the string Dashboard is found it skips the row. Or, even better a simple list I can define. Nevertheless, I failed with both of those attempts. Hence, the hacks below. Again, any help would be greatly appreciated. Drawer hack - line 1226 - lib/navigationlib.php - $this->add_front_page_course_essentials($this->rootnodes['site'], $SITE); //Removes Calendar and Private files + $this->rootnodes['home']->showinflatnavigation = false; // Removes Dashboard Right dropdown menu .dropdown-menu-right a.dropdown-item.menu-action:first-child{ display:none; /* Removes Dashboard */} PS Private files can be removed using user policies by defining the role of authenticated user (search for private uncheck everything).

Post title: Messaging 2.0 help
Post description: Hi all, Hope all are well. I have been trying to get the the send_message function of the messaging 2.0 API to work with through a block, and local/extension. However, I keep getting an error - exception: Error writing to database . Could anyone point me the direction of a example or tutorial that shows how to create a simple plugin that uses the Messaging 2.0 API? If not, could anyone help me with the above error. I am not sure why it is showing. Any help appreciated, some code extracts to follow: I have added the the message provider: 'instantmessage' => array( 'capability' => 'NULL' ), e.g code global $DB; $user1 = $DB->get_record('user', array('id'=>'3')); echo json_encode($user1); $user2 = $DB->get_record('user', array('id'=>'4')); echo json_encode($user2 ); $eventdata = new object(); $eventdata->component         = 'moodle';    // the component sending the message. Along with name this must exist in the table message_providers $eventdata->name              = 'instantmessage';        // type of message from that module (as module defines it). $eventdata->userfrom          = $user1;      // user object $eventdata->userto            = $user2;        // user object $eventdata->subject           = "test";   // very short one-line subject $eventdata->fullmessage       = "test";      // raw text $eventdata->fullmessageformat = "test";   // text format $eventdata->fullmessagehtml   = "test";      // html rendered version $eventdata->smallmessage      = '';             // useful for plugins like sms or twitter try { $result = message_send($eventdata); echo $result; } catch (Exception $e) { echo 'Caught exception: ',  $e->getMessage(), "\n"; }

Post title: Probs with xml-imports
Post description: Hi we have problems importing xml -file with questions from another moodle-plattform into our own. The error code (when we import an import file of moodle- XML -format) says (translated from German): ------- Reading questions from import file Error importing the question  Error Parsing  XML: No memory in line 2141, Character 8 The import file does not contain questions Import error -------- I only get the error for bigger import files. This is for instance due to support files (e.g. bmp-files) attached to questions. The problem of course is that parsing takes too long. So I increased the memory_limit in the php-ini. Without success. However If we have  an import file of say 10 MB the error occurs. This is not acceptable. Do you have a solution in order to let moodle import „bigger“ import files ? We use: Moodle 2.9.1 dom DOM/XML enabled DOM/XML API Version 20031129 libxml Version 2.9.1 HTML Support enabled XPath Support enabled XPointer Support enabled Schema Support enabled RelaxNG Support enabled Thanks in advance Sonja

Post title: Run single scheduled task from the Moodle interface
Post description: Hello, I know the TASK API allows you to run individual scheduled tasks from the command line and that is great but does anyone see a benefit in running a single scheduled task from the Moodle interface. This question stems from two situations  : 1) Moodle administrators do not have access to the web server 2) <moodle>/admin/cron.php web page timing out ! When a site is particularly busy and you need to run that ONE task and cant wait it would be really hand to think about building a plugin that would do that for you from the admin interface. The reason I pose this question here is because I am sure during  building the new Task API moodle developers must have thought about this and probably thought ' naahhh!' . just wanted to understand if there was a reason behind this ? Thanks Hittesh

Post title: Bug with course / activities / user re-creation
Post description: Hi! I had a course with several activities and users. Put it to use 2 months ago, everything was Ok. Deleted the course, dropped the users. Created a new course with new users and activities. I used the same usernames. I found out that moodle reused the id on every table. And I have the following problems: Course administration - Enroled users: all of them show up as enroled two days ago (right), and none of them as ever accessed the course (right) Course administration - Reports - Activity Reports: the course and users where created a week ago, but I see activity from 2 months ago (when the other course was put to use). Some activities, brand new, never used (eg. questionnaire without questions still on them) show up as completed by all of the users. I think the logs, and the re-use of ids on several tables, maybe confusing moodle. I tried editing the id on several tables - WRONG. Any way I can fix them, and have moodle truly forget my old course and let me keep on working on the new one? Regards.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Does this query run on Oracle and MSSQL?
Post description: If you have Moodle running on MSSQL or Oracle does the following query run: 
```text
SELECT ue.userid, ue.enrolid,
    MIN(xpue.status + xpe.status) AS pstatus,
    MIN(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0) THEN xpue.timestart ELSE 9999999999 END) AS ptimestart,
    MAX(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0) THEN
        (CASE WHEN xpue.timeend = 0 THEN 9999999999 ELSE xpue.timeend END)
        ELSE 0 END) AS ptimeend
FROM mdl_user_enrolments ue
    JOIN mdl_enrol e ON (e.id = ue.enrolid AND e.enrol = 'meta' )
    JOIN mdl_user_enrolments xpue ON (xpue.userid = ue.userid)
    JOIN mdl_enrol xpe ON (xpe.id = xpue.enrolid AND xpe.enrol <> 'meta'
        AND xpe.enrol IN ('manual', 'cohort', 'meta') AND xpe.courseid = e.customint1)
GROUP BY ue.userid, ue.enrolid
HAVING (MIN(xpue.status + xpe.status) = 0 AND MIN(ue.status) > 0)
    OR (MIN(xpue.status + xpe.status) > 0 AND MIN(ue.status) = 0)
    OR ((CASE WHEN MIN(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0)
         THEN xpue.timestart ELSE 9999999999 END) = 9999999999
         THEN 0 ELSE MIN(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0)
         THEN xpue.timestart ELSE 9999999999 END) END) <> MIN(ue.timestart))
    OR ((CASE 
         WHEN MAX(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0)
             THEN (CASE WHEN xpue.timeend = 0 THEN 9999999999 ELSE xpue.timeend END)
             ELSE 0 END) = 9999999999
         THEN 0 ELSE MAX(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0)
         THEN (CASE WHEN xpue.timeend = 0
             THEN 9999999999 ELSE xpue.timeend END)
         ELSE 0 END) END) <> MAX(ue.timeend))
```
 I'm trying to verify it works on those two databases to hopefully improve performance of a meta enrollment query: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-43176

Forum Post: 
Post title: Application cache store value should be reinitialized in case of Apache restart
Post description: Hi, I have implemented local plugin that initialize an instance of RabbitMQ consumer for Moodle 2.6. There should always be only one instance of consumer for the whole application running in the background. After 300 seconds or 100 consumed messages, consumer terminates and new consumer is created. Since I don't want administrator to run cron job to trigger consumer , and Task API is not available for Moodle 2.6, my approach to trigger consumer for the first time is to check in my event observer if consumer is running and start it if not. I used Moodle application cache store to store the value "consumer_enabled" to true or false, to prevent trigger to create new consumer if there is already one running in the background. It works fine, except when Apache is restarted. In that case, consumer terminates, but value in store remains true, so after Apache starts, my trigger will not initialize consumer again. Hope somebody have idea how to solve this problem, or suggest some other approach that would work better in my scenario. Thanks Zoran

I only want one instance each of the resources because, of course, I only want to have to edit them once. If I enrol the users to give them access to the resources, they will see this course in their list of courses on their dashboard . I don't want them to see it though in 'my courses', as I only want them to see their 'official' list of courses. If I could keep the course  'hidden' but available I could achieve this. Unless there's an existing way of doing this? Should I raise a tracker? I'm not a developer so would not be able to contribute practically myself (except for testing). Thanks Catherine

Post title: Licensing/code implications of distributing external file chooser with plugin code
Post description: Hello all. I'm working on a repository plugin which uses an external web service to provide the file chooser (similar to the Equella plugin). However, to keep the plugin installation simple, I'm considering bundling the web service with the plugin code. In effect, the plugin's external file chooser will be available at http://moodle_url/repository/myplugin/service. (It can still be deployed externally, if desired, though.) Does this have any licensing or code checking implications? The web service code, while distributed with the plugin, is effectively a third party library when used this way. Do the usual Moodle code review processes apply to that code? Does it need to by GPL v3 licensed, or is that only required for the piece of code which calls the web service to load the external file chooser? Do I need to worry about whether the web service code uses libraries which replicate code in Moodle core (I'd prefer the web service to be independent of Moodle, so I don't really want to use Moodle's libraries, and would prefer to use those of my own choosing which I control)? Thanks. Elliot Smith

Forum Post: 
Post title: UnEnroll API slow on bulk un-enrollments in clustered configuration
Post description: Hi, The MySQL clustering configuration we have is full two way synchronized replication across US and EU servers.   We know this is a bit of bottleneck on bulk operations after profiling. Specifically when we programmatically un-enroll bunch of users in US, depending on the number users, it can take up to 30 minutes to unEnroll in this configuration which in turn results in the My SQL transactions having to also do the same in EU. We are calling the enrol_plugin->unenroll_user( x, y)  for every user. This API in turn calls bunch of other apis which include queries, deletes, etc. which the MySQL replication is choking on. My question is: is there a batch unEnroll api that we can pass the user id's, course id  to that would do this in bulk and be faster ? If not, is there a update SQL that we can run instead to do the same thing that we can simply call. Thanks A

Post title: Storing a file in moodle
Post description: Hi everybody, I am currently working on an activity module, where the creator should be able to upload a pdf (or select an already existing pdf, which is already stored in moodle). There are also some other kind of information submitted within the same form as the file. I already figured out how to store the information except the file. in the mod_form.php I already added the filepicker element, but somehow i am unable to save and store the the pdf  in my add_instance function (inside lib.php). As far as i understood, there are two ways to store a file in moodle: 1. Store it by yourself within the activity module, or 2. let the file api of moodle manage and save the submitted file. I would like to do the second thing, since I want also offer the opportunity to select an already existing file within this lecture/module and would like to keep all the pdfs reusable within other plugins. So i already read the files api documentation and checked some other activity modules, but somehow I am unable to figure out how to properly add this file. I also had a briefly look over the resource mod files, but again without success. Could someone share an concrete example of how to store a pdf with moodles file api (or anything else that would fit my requirements)? I am fairly new to moodle plugin development and might be on the wrong track here, so any help is appreciated. thanks in advance!

Post title: Using the Access API within a Local Plugin
Post description: I'm developing a plugin that adds a menu icon to Moodle's navigation bar (left of the notifications & messages menus, in v3).  The best way I could find to add it was with jQuery, using myplugin_extend_navigation() as a trigger to run: 
```text
$PAGE->requires->js_call_amd('myplugin/myjscode', 'init', array($myparam))
```
 That seems to work fine for me, but this context seems to be restricting what I want to do next. I'd like the menu to be rendered differently for admin users, vs. student or teacher users.  Since there isn't a simple isAdmin property to check, I've used the Access API to check the permissions on an action that I assume only admins can take.  This code has been working in my dev environment: 
```text
$isAdmin = has_capability('moodle/site:manageblocks', context_module::instance(1) );
```
 The problem is that not every environment will have a context module with the ID 1.  So, I started looking for ways to check for valid module IDs. A module can get the $cm argument from _extend_navigation() , but a local plugin only gets $nav . $PAGE->cm is also empty. Are there other options to identify admin users in this case?  Thanks in advance.

Post title: Migrated Moodle site thinks installation is in progress/required
Post description: I recently inherited a Moodle installation that has been largely ignored for a long time (or so I'm told).  I know basically nothing about Moodle development/administration, but I know my way around PHP and server /db administration. The previous developer left nothing behind in terms of documentation or help at all, so I'm trying to get this installation running locally so I can start to work on it. I have the db and code copied to a local VM , pretty straight forward, everything should be fine, but for some reason when I try to access the site locally, it takes me to the "configure your main administrator account" screen, part of installation.  So for some reason, the site thinks it needs to be installed still, or finish being installed or something.  The db and code I have are from the production site, which runs fine.  So I'm wondering what I'm missing. I'm hoping some of you can point me to what checks Moodle does to decide whether or not installation is complete, or give me some idea of why it thinks it needs an admin account, when it should already exist. Hopefully that's enough to go on. Thanks! Oh, according to version.php in the code, the version is 2015051105.03

Post title: Gradebook recalculating
Post description: I was investigating an issue where individual marks are "wrong" in the gradebook for some students but not others, and I found --- Recalculating If you change any part of an assessment e.g. alter the maximum grade for one of the questions in a quiz, you may find that the columns do not yet reflect the change you have made. Click Turn editing on twice to force the gradebook to re-check. Alternatively, in the Categories and items tab, locking then un-locking any item will update the values for that item. Note: locking categories will lock/unlock any child categories and items; be careful to not unlock activities you want to be locked! --- in the Moodle docs ( https://docs.moodle.org/26/en/Gradebook#Recalculating ) and I was curious, after looking at the code, as to how Moodle is detecting turning editing on twice...

This should return the execution of the PHP file, but what it does is to return the content of the PHP file in plain text. As an example, returns: <?php echo "This is a sample." ?> instead of This is a sample. As can be seen, This call reaches the PHP file but somehow it doesn´t execute it, just reads and returns plain text. Must be said that this works locally if I play my course directly in a browser, before making a SCORM Package,  so Ajax function and PHP file code work correctly. I think that it could be some issue with permissions or something like that... I have made some test that works. I have located my PHP file in another server , and after adding the CORS header to this PHP file, executes it and works correctly. This is some solution to my problem, but I can´t understand why this PHP file isn´t executed normally when if it is located in the same package as the rest of the SCORM Package. If it helps, I paste here my ajax function: $.ajax({ type: 'post', url: 'file.php', data: {student_id: student_id}, success:function(response) { console.log(response); GetPlayer().SetVar("nombre", datos[1]); GetPlayer().SetVar("sexo", datos[2]); } }, error : function() { console.log('responseFail'); } }); I hope someone has encountered this same problem and has an answer to it. Forum Post: 
Post title: ES6 support in grunt uglify?
Post description: Hi, I'm looking at using a 3rd-party JS library in a plugin, but it uses ES6 - which isn't supported by the version of uglify set in package.json for M3.3 - it chokes with parse errors on the new syntax. Fortunately, there's a ES6 compatible "harmony" branch of UglifyJS , which is compatible. Changing package.json from 
```text
"grunt-contrib-uglify": "1.0.1",
```
 to 
```text
"grunt-contrib-uglify": "gruntjs/grunt-contrib-uglify#harmony",
```
 ...and running `npm update` fixes the parse errors, and is presumably backwards-compatible - unfortunately I can't run Behat at the moment to run check for regressions. Would I be right in thinking that grunt-contrib-uglify will need to merge their ES6 support into their main release, before Moodle can adopt it? Cheers, Dave.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Proposed change of mdl_user_preferences.value to TEXT
Post description: See MDL-46739 . Other similar columns like mdl_config.value and mdl_config_plugins.value are TEXT, so it is surprising that this column is different, and that suprise has lead to bugs in the past (see linked issues of that tracker issue). Obviously a TEXT column will be fractionally slower than a VARCHAR on some databases, but I don't think it will be significant. (User preferences for the current user are cached in the session.) Anyway, just though I ought to publicise that proposed change. Comments welcome.

Post title: Course Format Topics Renderer override not working?
Post description: Moodle: v3.3.1 Theme: Mytheme (cloned from Boost for template/layout, but using own styles) Hi there, I'm trying to change the way Course listing page is at the moment. It uses Topic format where all topics/modules of a course are listed first as links followed by a new page where each section's individual activities /resources appear. I'd like to - Move the "Forums or General" section on the right with other blocks - Add some of our own CSS classes in the markup to style the Course Listing page as per our theme The theme config has the below renderer set and I also have a core_renderer in my theme working perfectly fine 
```text
$THEME->rendererfactory = 'theme_overridden_renderer_factory';
```
 https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=229890 is somewhat similar to what I'm trying to do but not sure if it's the correct way & what should be the folder/naming convention? As per the above link, rather than extending `format_section_renderer_base`, it's best to extend `format_topics_renderer` as that's the format being used. So have followed that path but to no success. This is what I have so far: 
```text
theme
  mytheme
     classes
        output
           core
              course_format_topics_renderer.php
```
 
```text
namespace theme_mytheme\output\core;




defined('MOODLE_INTERNAL') || die();




use moodle_url;
```

```text
format_topics_renderer::print_single_section_page
format_topics_renderer::print_multiple_section_page
```
 Any thoughts or guidance in this direction will be appreciated? Thanks in advance!

Post description: Hi, I'd be very grateful if any fellow members of the community could confirm whether their implementation of Moodle 3.1 and Unoconv is capable of converting documents which contain non-latin or special characters in their filenames? In our testing, it's not (this is under Moodle 3.1.1, PHP 5.6 and Unoconv 0.7). While conversion of documents containing such characters in their filenames is successful via the command line, submitting the same document to an assignment in Moodle and then attempting to view the converted version only results in a blank page (please note that otherwise our Moodle/Unoconv installation seems to be functioning fine). Just to be clear here, I'm talking about documents which contain characters such as the following in their filename: àéíôü!@#$%^&*()-_+= or other non-English character sets e.g. Chinese, Japanese, etc. Please can other users verify whether this does or doesn't work on their system and let me know. If there's a broader issue I'll then create a tracker item and hopefully it will get resolved asap. Just for reference, I did notice that another user made mention of this same issue via an existing tracker issue (butwhich relates to a separate bug): https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-54914?focusedCommentId=414723&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-414723 Many thanks.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Large scale moodle installations 30.000+ users - tips?
Post description: Hi, I have been reading here and around the web, on which precautions to make when making a large scale moodle. We are counting on 30.000 - 60.000 users, and that will of cause take its toll on the server (s). But which measurements are we talking about? Do we need a cluster of servers to run the site and another to run the database ? Do we need one big monster machine to run the site and another to run the database. Do we need one Big monster only to minimize mysql hang-load time. There are many different suggestions, but i like to hear from those who has experience in such a large scale solution. What are the requirements, for the hardware? I hope you can help. Thanks, kind regards Henrik Sune Pedersen

Post title: backup_release and backup_version in mdl_config
Post description: Using MSSQL 2008 R2 with $dbtype = 'ms sql ', I upgraded a Moodle version 2.0.4 site to Moodle version 2.9.1. After the upgrade was done I ran the following command in the Moodle database : 
```text
SELECT


   id,


   name,


   value


FROM mdl_config


WHERE name LIKE '%release%'


OR name LIKE '%version%'


ORDER BY name
```
 It returns this data: 
```text
id    name    value


3142    allversionshash    xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx


239    backup_release    2.0


238    backup_version    2010111800


240    blocks_version    2007081300
```
 What do the backup_release and backup_version rows mean? What is a "backup_release" and a "backup_version"? Thanks.

Post title: Writing a \core\event\course_completed observer
Post description: I'm writing a plugin that needs to inform an external system when a course has been completed. The \core\event\course_completed hook seemed like the obvious place, but I cannot get my observer to fire consistently. I think the disconnect is either not connecting the observer correctly, or not understanding when and under what circumstances that event fires. Here's my db/events.php 
```text
$observers = array(


    array(


        'eventname' => '\core\event\course_completed',


        'callback'  => '\auth_foo\observer::course_completed'


    )


);
```
 I have verified that the auth_foo\observer class conforms to the expectations of the autoload system. I've also verified that my plugin is listed in an observer of that event in the admin area. In order to test this, I was creating a course, with self enrolment and self-completion. I did see my observer called a few times (based on logs), but not consistently. I'm not sure what the difference was when it worked vs when it did not. What am I missing? Am I connecting the observer wrong? Is my course setup wrong? I'm hoping this is some obvious oversight on my part. The document was not very helpful. Thanks, Yael

Post title: Customizing the user Registration Form
Post description: Hi all, I'm building out a new product on a shiny new Moodle 2.0 installation, and I'm hoping to keep the core as clean as possible. Unfortunately, my very first task is making me butt heads with this goal. I need to make some significant changes to the Moodle Registration form. The first is to allow multiple users to share an email address. The second is to require a unique code in order to register for the site and another to register for a specific course. Additionally, I need to set up a second registration form that will allow registered users to add another course using a username, password, and unique course code. I'm looking for a way to integrate the registration form into my authentication plugin or to override the registration form by some other means. Is it possible to override the registration form without editing it directly? I'm certainly open to solutions I've not yet considered, but the parameters of my problem are set by the client and I have little to no sway in that regard. Thanks for your time, Chriis

Forum Post: 
Post title: Two issues with "lock" for grade and grade category items
Post description: Hello, some teachers of the institution i work for found two issues with the "locked" field of a grade/category item. If you try to edit a category grade item, let's say, you change the max grade and also checks the "locked" checkbox, your maxgrade is edited but the item is not locked. Then you change just the locked status, save and it works. If you try to change the maxgrade again and at same time unlock the item, it works. I have not found an issue on tracker related to this. This is more problematic. You have a "locked" category item, the locked help text says: "If ticked, grades can no longer be automatically updated by the related activity. "  But if you change, let's say, maxgrades again, then the item is updated but the grades are not recalculated, because of the locked option. So, it is not only by the related activity, but any changes won't take effect until you unlock the item (settings areare stored and retrieved ok, but no changes to grades). So, this help message hides part of the problem. It may be somewhat related to MDL-48634 It seems this is not the expected behaviour. If the changes really should not be applied, then the form fields for other settings should be disabled when the item is locked. But it seems to be a difficult approach: what if you lock an item, save it, get back to it, unlock, change something, lock again and save? This way, the more appropriate behaviour would be to apply the changes and recalculate grades even if the items are locked, just for the item settings, not for the activities as is said on the help text. What do you think? Kind regards,

Forum Post: 
Post title: MUC identifiers, proposed change to implementation
Post description: Hi, During my implementation of MDL-53213 it realised that MUC identifiers can change the cache pointer of an existing cache eg; $properties = array('dbfamily' => 'pg sql '); $cache = cache::make('core', 'databasemeta', $properties); Then; $properties = array('dbfamily' => ' mysql '); $cache2 = cache::make('core', 'databasemeta', $properties); This will result in $cache = $cache2, which is not what I would have expected as a developer.  It feels dangerous and counter intuitive. Proposal: Identifiers and Sharing options be added to the definition_hash. Identifiers would not be able to be changed once a cache::make has been called.  You will need to complete a second cache::make if you need a different cache option set. Remove multikeyprefix.  This would be handled by the store as the singlekeyprefix along with the definition hash if that was interesting to the store.  Some may need it for keys, others may not as definition hashes will have separated it. This will then uniquely identify a cache by those things and the code above would result in two separate instances.  It also has a benefit of allowing developers to purge a cache based on that new definition.  So in the databasemeta case, I would just purge the pgsql cache, and not all of them.  Developers can then use this function to make identifiers like smaller sub-caches for certain use cases.  I've had a couple where I want the identifier to be a userid or forumid and manage it as a separate cache. Generate singlekeyprefix would then not be required, the singlekeyprefix is the definition hash. Then the way definition hash and key hash are handled should be pushed downwards into the store.  A reason for this is something like; Redis can uses hashes for each of the definitions. A filestore can do the same thing. Memcached would need to use a different strategy of prefixing the definition hash before the key_hash in a single key.  But it has to do that now.  It will still have all the same purge problems.  But other caches would no longer suffer from purging all versions of identifiers and sharing options when a cache is purged. There is currently very little documentation about the usefulness of identifiers and it's original intended use.  I have spend quite some time working on the caching code and still don't understand the purpose they were made for.  My idea above is much clearer to me. Possible future direction is also to push the calculation of the key into the store rather than the loader.  The store is the one that needs to handle restriction on the keyspace.  Whether it's size or character options available.  Each store could determine the best rules for it.  This coupled with the definition hash change would let a store decide how it indexes the content we send to it.  File stores can have directories, redis can have hashes, mongodb can do the same kind of thing.  Memory caches can just use keys as-is and memcached could put the keys together as it can't ensure unique keys without that. I would like feedback on whether others think this is a move in the right direction and if there are any objections or ideas around this proposal.

Post title: Moodle session timeout not being respected
Post description: I have a moodle installation (2.7.9) that used to work fine. When we deployed an IDM-sso solution ( Oracle Access Manager) that included a load balancer, our problems started. 1) First, a user that was authenticated correctly (using a custom built auth plugin) 2) When the user tries to post a forum message everything is ok 3) When a user starts writing the forum message and spends more than 120 seconds on that page and the clicks the post button he/she gets the message " Sorry, guests are not allowed to post." 4) When he/she clicks continue they are shown as logged in. I immediately started searching for session time out, and using a script, i figured out that moodle was throwing him out after ~120 seconds (session timeout is set in 2 hours). Sessions are handled in the DB ( MySQL ). When i printed the $SESSION var i got 
```text
object(stdClass)#69 (1) {
  ["has_timed_out"]=>
  bool(true)
}
```
 Any clues on what might be happening?

Post description: Hello, I have written and maintain several plugins (mainly blocks) that we use at my small institution. I'm curious about your strategy to update blocks when you upgrade to a newer Moodle version. Typically, I upgrade the Moodle core on a dev server and see if the blocks throw any errors on update. Post description: Hi All, We are interested in trying to do something about this: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-45777 But rather than (or as well as) "warning" have the ability to prevent users deleting assignments with submissions all together. There are a couple of ways to do this, the simplest (for us to put in a quick fix) would be to botch the backend code but that wouldn't be good from a users perspective as the initial screens / YUI Modal would imply they could delete. A better approach would be to consider additional capabilities for modules like module:delete-instance-without-data

Forum Post: 
Post title: Request for comment on new plugin
Post description: Hello, I'm developing a new local/plugin that I called customclasses. The aim of this plugin is: - provide a mechanism to override through inheritance most of Moodle core classes (Eg. moodlepage,  any renderer, etc etc) - this mechanism should be theme independent - this mechanism should not conflict with standard moodle edition - but rather co-exist so that one could quickly switch on/off according to his needs - and obviously survive a moodle version upgrade In its basic form the plugin ships with only an empty derived custom_page class [CODE] class custom_page extends moodlepage{ //you decide what to override } [/CODE] and a customloader class to use this class to initialise the $PAGE instance and a plugin setting to switch on/off the plugin itself and a couple of lines to add in config.php While I know this is a rather controversial idea (and maybe already discarded by core developers), I think it still might interest someone and has some use cases. I set up a github repository ( https://github.com/mvit777/custom_moodle ) with a complete proof-of-concept implementation of the idea and extensive documentation. I thank in advance anyone who will to take the time to review/comment/criticize my work. M.

Forum Post: 
Post title: error/moodle/missingparam
Post description: Hi, I have installed snap theme into moodle3.3 but when i go to the main page of the snap I saw this problem and don't now how to solve it. error/moodle/missingparam A required parameter (id) was missing. This error happens when a webpage expects a parameter to be passed from another page (by post or cookie), and it fails to do so. This happens sometimes when user session times out, due to inactivity, or when an URL that needs that mandatory parameter is instead directly typed in URL bar or invoked from browser bookmarks, like the SCORM Player page not being launched from a link in the course page. Best regards.

Post title: How to dinamically disable/enable custom activity and block
Post description: Hi, I've created custom Moodle plugin that integrates other custom made Moodle activities and blocks. Since it will not be used in all courses and by all users I need to support hiding/showing it dynamically. In Moodle plugin I implemented it is possible to list all Moodle Activities and blocks and to activate it in specific course. If, for example, Moodle activity is not activated for specific course, I need to disable that Moodle activity for the teacher, so he can't add it in his course. I know how to make already created activities invisible, but I don't know how to remove activity from "Add an activity or resource" menu in edit mode so teacher is prevented to use something that is not to be used in his course. For Moodle block, I need to hide/show it in the similar way like with activities, on the course level, without having teacher to manually add it. Teacher would just activate specific item in my custom Moodle plugin, and if there is block related to that item it should be activated without teacher having to search which block should be activated. On the other side, I also need to support same request on the user level, so if student decides to turn off/on support provided by my plugin, it should hide/show custom block(s) that are integrated with my plugin. Hope somebody have some idea how I can make this work Thanks, Zoran

Forum Post: 
Post title: Architecture, Array vs SQL
Post description: Hi, im currently working on a Block Plugin that loads some data via the Competency-, Course Module- and Gradebook- API into arrays, calculates some stuff and writes it into the block content. Changes are only necessary if a student gets a new grade or something in the course structure changes. Since I want to build it with best practise and good performance architecture Im thinking about the following points: - I tried to do everything with API calls, parsing the needed data out of them. I could also put everything together in one self made SQL Query with some Joins. Which option is the better one? - Should I hold all the data in arrays or create and insert a new DB table? I guess arrays would have the better performance but the database solution maybe prettier and easier to maintain? - At the moment Im executing everything in the get_content() function in the main file, so everything is loaded all the time with every site refresh, which is not optimal regarding performance and modularity I guess. How can I design that better? - With a database solution I would calculate everything and store it in a table. Then I would have to listen to events and everytime an activity gets graded or something in the course changes, like a new activity gets created, I would have to update the table in the database. Does that make sense? I hope somebody can give me some advice regarding these issues! Also a link to an example plugin covering some of this things would help a lot! Thank you!

Post title: Moodle Customisation Perspective
Post description: I currently have a Moodle 2.5 based tool customised to create quizzes from a huge question database (most are multiple choice). My problem is that i need to create new categories/taxonomies for these questions, considering each question is supposed to support the structure below: Question X - Level * - Knowledge Area * - - Subject * - Thematic Axis - Modality - Transversal Theme of which are mandatory the ones marked with a *. As long as i know, each question can only have one category, so I'd leave it for a mandatory field. I considered the possibility of using a category structure for the Subject and maybe leave the optional fields for the tags. It would be good to organize them better than just throwing every one of them into a cloud of tags. Anyways, I need to understand better what resources could Moodle offer me to use multiple categories, tags, taxonomies and other ways of organising the questions. I would also appreciate some suggestions to implement whatever is needed to support this structure and perspective of the complexity of what I'm trying to achieve. Thanks in advance

"; } if (has_capability('moodle/legacy:teacher', $context, $USER->id, false) ) { echo "is Assitent Teacher
"; } if (has_capability('moodle/legacy:editingteacher', $context, $USER->id, false)) { echo "is Teacher
"; } if (has_capability('moodle/legacy:admin', $context, $USER->id, false)) { echo "is ADMIN
"; } */ // Add file picker callback. //Checking whether the current course belongs to Course Category and check user has got the appropriate roles if(PERMITTED_COURSE_CATEGORY_ID == $course_category && in_array($roleid,$valid_role_ids)) { if (empty($options['legacy'])) { if (isset($options['maxfiles']) and $options['maxfiles'] != 0) { $params['file_browser_callback'] = "M.editor_tinymce.filepicker"; } } if ($row = $this->find_button($params, 'moodleemoticon')) { // Add button after 'moodleemoticon' icon. $this->add_button_after($params, $row, 'moodlemedia', 'moodleemoticon'); } else if ($row = $this->find_button($params, 'image')) { // Note: We know that the plugin emoticon button has already been added // if it is enabled because this plugin has higher sortorder. // Otherwise add after 'image'. $this->add_button_after($params, $row, 'moodlemedia', 'image'); } else { // Add this button in the end of the first row (by default 'image' button should be in the first row). $this->add_button_after($params, 1, 'moodlemedia'); } // Add JS file, which uses default name. $this->add_js_plugin($params); } } protected function get_sort_order() { return 110; } } Kind Regards, Joe Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Wrong character encoding as "combined diacritics" instead of the proper "precomposed characters"
Post description: Background: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Combining_character https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Precomposed_character Preface: this is a issue in dnduploadlib.php in the course directory and unknown other places. I tried to file an issue in the moodle issue tracker, but as a not that tech savvy person, the obstacles to actually file an issue drove me nuts – so I put the issue here, maybe someone catches it up. *** When uploading a file via dnduploadlib.php, characters with diacritics like german ä, ö, ü in the filename are encoded as so called "composed characters / combining characters": an <ä> is composed out of an <a> combined with an <¨>. In combination with some operatimg systems, browsers and webfonts (OSX, Firefox and Open Sans, for example) these combined characters are faultly interpreted as two separate symbols: <a¨>, which leads to a problem when using things like auto-linking: When I upload a file called "Mäuse.pdf" for example, and autolinking for files is on, then typing the string "Mäuse.pdf" with the keyboard doesn't lead to an autolinked entry because the character "ä" in the filename is encoded as (hex)61CC88, whilst when using the keyboard the character "ä" is encoded as (hex)C3A4. dnduploadlib.php has to be aware of these combined diacritics ((hex)61CC88 for example) and should convert them to the proper precomposed characters ((hex)C3A4 for example). For my special needs, I hacked dnduploadlib.php and replaced the german umlauts. Since I am a frontend developer, that's all I can contribute to this issue, would be great, if a more tech savvy person could find a more radical and generic solution – I've found out, that the same problem occurs on a forum, even when dnduploadlib.php is patched; but I couldn't figure out, what code part is responsible for that.

Post title: Installed block not showing in 'Add block'
Post description: Here's a general question with a very specific context , related to a custom-developed block. First the question: Why might a correctly-installed block not appear in the Add a Block dropdown in edit mode? Now the context: I've created a block - call it Hamster Herding - for local use. I've developed and tested it on localhost using Moodle 2.6 and XAMPP, then deployed it on a live test system. It used to work fine on local and remote hosts. We then decided that it needed to be renamed. I went through all the renaming procedures (files, variables, caches, etc), then put the block in moodle/blocks/hamster_herding and installed it via Admin >> Notifications. The block appeared to install ok, and when I then went into Site Admin >> Plugins >> Blocks >> Manage Block s I could see it listed there. However, it didn't appear in the Add a Block dropdown so of course I couldn't add it to a course. Neither do any error messages appear. Amongst many other measures, I've: de- and re-installed the block flushed Moodle caches flushed browser caches from the beginning of time set developer errors to super-picky installed the block on another machine altogether changed the block version number read TFM and TFFAQ I think it's almost certainly related to the use of caches in the block, which are needed because of the institutional context in which it'll be deployed. I have just used basic cacheing code as specified in the Cache API , and when renaming the block made sure to rename the block caches. I'm sure that it'll be one tiny tweak somewhere that's needed, but I just can't find the cause of the problem as I'm getting no feedback from Moodle at all, so a pointer or two would be appreciated. Still fumbling in the undergrowth... Fred

Forum Post: 
Post title: Convenience tables
Post description: Thinking about an enhancement I would like to see, I have started to look at the Moodle codebase, from a position of having never written PHP.  One of the things I have noticed is that there are quite a few integer fields in tabes that can only be meaningfully interpreted by referring back to the code; for example, course_completion_criteria. It may simply be that I'm looking in the wrong place, but I could not see any table that mapped the integer to a string; that only occurs, AFAICT, in completion_criteria.php. If this is so, has the possibility of providing convenience tables been mooted?  Such tables would be auto-generated from the code, and would only be referred to in ad hoc queries, so they would have no impact on the performance of the system, but would be a great boon to those, like me, who are trying to get a handle on what's happening in the database . It occurs to me that this would be an easy and no-risk way of getting my feet wet with the codebase. Am I on the right track?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Questions about Moodle GPL licence
Post description: Any idea or clarification about my following questions? I would be thankful for cthis I am
creating a website application using Moodle software, the website will
be teaching language, and nothing to do with information technology. I
need clarity on what you mean by "*Modified Version *" Why should my language students be
interested in the source code of the platform. Also
what do you mean by *'program's users'* - does this refer to students? who
access my application to learn language, or other software programmers who
may want to create a similar application - am I obliged by the GPL to give
them my modified source code? Also
with respect to this GPL, what is the definition of "modified
program"? Please
refer to the below FAQ from your website https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-faq.en.html#GPLRequireSourcePostedPublic Q: Does
the GPL require that source code of modified versions be posted to the public? (#GPLRequireSourcePostedPublic https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-faq.en.html#GPLRequireSourcePostedPublic >) Q: Does the GPL require that source code of modified versions be posted to the public if we use moodle as part of our project? (Please see para below from GPL) The
GPL does not require you to release your modified version, or any part of
it. You are free to make modifications and use them privately, without ever
releasing them. This applies to organizations (including companies), too;
an organization can make a modified version and use it internally without
ever releasing it outside the organization. But
*if* you release the modified version to the public in some way, the GPL
requires you to make the modified source code available to the program's users,
under the GPL. Thus,
the GPL gives permission to release the modified program in certain ways,
and not in other ways; but the decision of whether to release it is up
to you. Q2: Does it mean that if my organization uses Moodle in the business, we can not release this project to the public rather we can only use internally ? If it is so, how can we execute our project using Moodle? We are to sell courses to the public. ------------------------------------------ Sorry for misconceptions if have, clarification will be highly appreciated: Regards Salman

Forum Post: 
Post title: Announcement: ER diagram for the competency tables
Post description: As part of my ongoing project to create ER (Entity Relationships) diagrams for Moodle I have been working on enhancing the tool I use to generate the SQL that I reverse engineer into the diagram. The latest feature is to allow me to create some XML that stores "inferred relationships", i.e. tables/columns that look like they should have primary/foreign key relationships (PK/FK) but where that data is not in the Moodle table source code. The first fruit of this is a diagram that I believe to show the relationships between the tables in the competencies module delivered for Moodle 3.1. You can see a first attempt at this at http://www.examulator.com/er/3.1/components/competency.png and http://www.examulator.com/er/3.1/components/competency.pdf (same diagram different format). Note that if the image appears fuzzy, click your mouse and it will come into focus. I intend to produce a diagram for 3.1 in the same way as I have for previous versions of Moodle (see the 3.0 diagram here http://www.examulator.com/er/ ) and will work through each of the sub components as seen here http://www.examulator.com/er/components/index.html The code that generates the SQL and manages the additional relationships can be found here https://github.com/marcusgreen/moodle_local-sqlgenerator All feedback greatly appreciated.

Post title: Retrieve Parent Category Name Using SQL
Post description: Greetings, I am almost there but seem to be missing something.  Here's the code I have: 
```text
SELECT
ma.course "course id",
mcc.name,
mcc.parent,
c.shortname "course",
c.category,
ma.name "assignment Name"

FROM mdl_course c
join mdl_course_categories mcc on mcc.id = c.category
join mdl_course_modules mcm on c.id = mcm.course
join mdl_modules mm on mm.id = mcm.module
join mdl_assign ma on mcm.instance = ma.id

WHERE c.shortname LIKE '%ACC%'
AND mm.name = 'assign' 
AND ma.name = 'ACC 201 Assessment'
ORDER by c.category
```
 The problem with the SQL is that the doesn't retrieve the parent. The courses are setup as follows: (2015-2016) -> Each campus is listed (AUG, MIL, etc.) -> Each term is listed (16SPCMP, 16SUCMP, etc.). It appears that somewhere I'm struggling to combine a table to pull the parent. Any ideas?

Forum Post: 
Post title: New ER diagram for Moodle 2.8 database structure available
Post description: I have released a version of the Moodle database entity relationship (ER) diagram generated from the Moodle 2.9 code which can be found at http://www.examulator.com/er Although the tables in core Moodle do not change a much between releases this diagram is a little more ambitious than the previous ones. It incorporates relationships missing from the release code which can be found in this bug report https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-49795 Also the SQL code that was used to reverse engineer the diagram included field comments. When Moodle is installed it will normally throw away all field level comments. I updated the code so it kept the comments. Due to some quirks the comments may be truncated but I decided some information is better than none. This diagram is probably most helpful if you download the *.mwb file and load it up in MySQL workbench (a free cross platform tool) but I hope the graphics/png files are also useful. Check out the component diagrams as well at http://www.examulator.com/er/components/index.html

Doing this manually for each student takes a lot of time and requires someone to open each quiz for each student at the right time. with regards Davíð

Post title: Trigger Site Policy and login from one link
Post description: I've been asked to ensure we have records of all users accepting our revised AUP but have a problem with how Moodle is handling redirections in our scenario, was wondering if anyone has any ideas... users are on LDAP auth i.e. no SSO when they open the site user needs to click a shortcut on a PC desktop to open up Moodle and accept the AUP if not logged in they need to be prompted to sign in after login they get redirected to either a URL that triggers the policy acceptance or to My Moodle (which also seems to trigger it) The problems we have are: auto-login of guests is enabled therefore I can't link to http://siteurl/my as it won't trigger a login box preventing access to My Moodle for Guests only redirects to the home page so no good there either linking directly to http://siteurl/user/policy.php just redirects to the home page due to the auto-login as Guest customising either login/index.php or /my/index.php doesn't seem to work if I try a redirect in the code (goes off to home page rather than going back to the page that was launched before the login attempt) The Site Policy behaviour also seems to be different to how I recall it in the past; I thought in older versions you couldn't view any part of the site until the Policy had been accepted but now this only seems to happen when the user tries to access a course page i.e. Front Page and My Moodle can be viewed without accepting the terms? Seems like there should be a way to achieve the behaviour I need but probably needs some custom code, any ideas would be much appreciated to save me tearing my hair out (!)
