Post title: Two Simultaneous Logins
Post description: I have been playing around with the way moodle handles sessions. I was able to login from both my laptop and my desktop on the same username. This is a problem for us, because we service large schools. What is to prevent them from only purchasing one username and allowing every student to log in as that username and password? Is there a way to prevent a user from logging in from multiple computers over the same username? Thanks in advance. Ryan
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: It's not a restriction that anyone really needs, because if every student uses the same username then education in Moodle simply won't work, since you won't be able to identify anyone, talk to them, grade their assignments and so on. Are you charging schools by SEAT?   I wouldn't recommend that.
Comment 2: This is a major issue for us as we are evaluating using Moodle for after-school environments where students regularly share userids to keep costs low.  The after-school providers are less concerned about quizes than utilizing a turn-key program that has little to no staffing and resource requirements that they have to fund.  Further, our courses are not time schedule based, any student can enroll at any time for a fixed period of time.  Our forums are more a historical knowledge base rather than a fixed resource for a specific semester period. We offer our courses at a very low cost so they are affordable for urban communities and per seat is critical in our business model.   In all of the example Moodle sites I have looked at to this point it seems that individual students enroll and pay via PayPal.  How is that different from per seat? We wrote our own PHP-based CyberSchool and implemented code that associated a key with the PHP session to not allow more than one computer to use the same userid at a given time.  Is this something that could be easily implemented in Moodle?
Comment 3: This is no the right place to ask but what is the recommended way to charge schools then ?

Comment 10: Is this working for moodle 1.9+ ?? Have anyone solved this issue? Thanks
Comment 11: This code is not working with moodle 1.9+. Someone need to change the code to make it work. Anshul Jain
Comment 12: Add a field into your moodle database user table (usually mdl_user): 
```text
login_session CHAR (32)
```
 Then, at the very end of config.php (just before the php closing tag "?>"), add: 
```text
$usercheck = get_record('user', 'id', $_SESSION['id1']);
if ($usercheck ->login_session !== md5($_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'].$_SERVER['HTTP_USER_AGENT']) && $usercheck ->username !== 'guest') {
 unset ($_SESSION['USER']);
 unset ($_SESSION['SESSION']);
 unset ($SESSION);
 unset ($USER);
}
```
 and in lib/moodlelib.php, look into the "authenticate_user_login" function, search for "return $user", and just before add: 
```text
$_SESSION['id1'] = $user->id;
$updateduserrecord = array ('id' => $user->id, 'login_session' => md5($_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'].$_SERVER['HTTP_USER_AGENT']));
$updateduserrecord = (object)$updateduserrecord;
update_record("user", $updateduserrecord);
```
 This way, if a second user (using a different IP address and/or a different web browser) logs in with the same credentials as an already logged in user, the first one is logged out.

It now means that the username can be logged into Computer1, but as soon as the username is logged into Computer2, Computer1 will timeout on the next action (Clicking a link for example) So, for the users who login at work, forget to logout and login at home, they can access the course with no real problems (except having to type their username twice). But for those giving their username out, this will cause great inconvenience. Forum Post: 
Post title: $DB->update_record appears to be dropping columns
Post description: Good afternoon all, A quick bit of background, I've been a PHP developer for a few years, this is the first time I've worked on a Moodle site, everything seems to be going well but I have an issue with one of my database fields. I have a database table with a number of columns, most of which are populated upon creation, a few of which are populated when the item has been looked at by the appropriate person. To clarify in the test process of this I've examined the stdClass immediately before it is parsed to the update_record and insert_record methods and all of the fields are set to the values I would expect. I've set the db to debug in the standard way. This is outputting me the UPDATE query, which has completely dropped a couple of the fields, most importantly a datetime field. I have tried renaming this field, I've tried adding a new column (INT) and storing the Unix timestamp to see if it was a DateTime related bug etc. and nothing seems to be working at all. To clarify my code isn't changing anything prior to the data entering the Moodle DB method I have done a print_r immediately before the line which calls update_record and can confirm that it shows all of the data. I have also then manually taken that print_r of the stdClass and copied and pasted the columns and values into a query which executes fine. Any advice or guidance on this would be great - I'm really stuck now and just can't understand why it isn't working Many thanks in advance! Matt
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Before generating the UPDATE statement, Moodle filters the included data to only include that which matches known columns in the database table (this is so that you can pass in an object that has extra fields in it, which will simply be ignored by the update command). The way that Moodle knows which fields should be in each table is (as far as I am aware) by looking in the db/install. xml files for each plugin (with this data being cached, to reduce time spent checking). As long as you define all your DB tables using the install.xml files + upgrade.php statements (and you bump your version number when these change), everything should work as expected. Problems usually start occurring when the fields have been manually added to the database, without using the Moodle upgrade API.
Comment 2: That's great, thank you very much for that. I have just checked the install.xml (which I've not used yet as this is in the very early stages of development) and have seen that my table has been copied into there, minus the problematic fields which would explain why this is occurring. Is there a way to prevent Moodle from doing this until later on in the process when the table structure is more likely to remain unchanged until future versions? Or a way to trigger Moodle to update the XML document, as it looks like it has done this already at least once? Many thanks for your reply, it's really helpful and appreciated Thanks, Matt
Comment 3: I would strongly advise using the built-in xmldb editor ( https://docs.moodle.org/dev/XMLDB_editor ) to generate the install.xml file for you. For changes to the definition, I would suggest you have 3 options: do it 'properly' (by using the xmldb editor to generate the upgrade statements, then add them to your db/upgrade.php file and bump the version number appropriately) reinstall your plugin when you change the install.xml file (site admin > plugins > manage plugins > uninstall; then visit site admin > notifications - Moodle should detect the 'new' plugin and install it again - NOTE this will wipe out any test data you had in the plugin's database tables) (not recommended, but might get away with it for very small changes) change the db/install.xml file, change the DB table (manually) to match, purge all caches (site admin > development > purge all caches)
Comment 4: Hi again Davo Thank you for another informative response. I simply purged the cache and when this rebuilt it seemed to have resolved my issues, and XMLDB doesn't always seem to work for me (due to the setup of my development server configurations and whatnot, I think) - but thanks for the post I do appreciate it Baring in mind that I already had the table changes in place as I didn't know that the schema was cached clearing the cache worked remarkably well as a recovery to a (in the "perspective" of the installation) was a questionable situation Thanks again for this Matt
Comment 5: Well, my first guess would be a cache issue. I'm guessing that you changed the table and those are the columns that are ignored. If this is the case, know that Moodle relies heavily on cache and the DB is also included somewhere inside. This means that Moodle 'remember' the structure of the tables, including the columns names and types. Any structure change of this kind need to be notified to Moodle. One way is to edit the table with the XMLDB editor, located in: Administration block -> Site administration -> Development. Another way is to manually change the DB and then call purge cache, either by by webpage of through CLI.
Comment 6: Thanks for your reply on this and thank you for the conversation in messages, it was really helpful

Forum Post: 
Post title: Get students on activity
Post description: Hi, I'm trying to get a list of students on a course activity (it's supposed to support any activity/module that can be installed) Initially I was just going to get the activity, find out what course it is on, then find all the students on that course, but I realised that doesn't take into account where it has been restricted to specific groups/groupings. Having a look at some of the mods, the "assign" mod has a method called count_participants (and list_participants ), which does take that into account and only gets the participants who should actually be on the activity, but that is just a method on that assign class so could only be used for that 1 mod. Whereas then looking at something like turnitintooltwo, that doesn't seem to really take the restrict access into account, as the student list in the submission inbox still shows all the students, regardless of group. And whilst other mods might have something similar, they are all their own separate methods in their own classes, which would make the supporting of any module/activity quite difficult. So... is there any kind of built in method or function in Moodle which I can use to find only the students who should actually be on a given activity/module? Or will I need to write one for that? Forum Post: 
Post title: SQL query - obtain unique login users
Post description: Hi, Would you mind to share what would be the appropriate mysql query to obtain unique login users on Moodle from 1st day of January 2018 to the current date? Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: ```text
  SELECT u.id, u.lastlogin 
    FROM mdl_user u
   WHERE u.deleted = 0 
         AND
         u.lastlogin >= UNIX_TIMESTAMP(TIMESTAMP('2018-01-01 00:00:00'))
GROUP BY u.id
ORDER BY u.lastlogin DESC
```
Comment 2: You are the man Darko! Thanks! How about from 1st of January 2018 to 31st of January 2018 with unique login users? How does the my sql query looks like?
Comment 3: We are here to help a bit, not do your homework. Use common sense to figure this out.
Comment 4: It seems this query is not working for Moodle version less than 2.6. When I run that query, there are no found for year 2018 but when in Moodle site at site administration on user list, I can see list of last access updated for 2018.
Comment 5: If you're using a version of Moodle less than 2.6, then the very next thing you should do is to upgrade to a newer version of Moodle. Moodle 2.6 stopped receiving security fixes (let alone bug fixes) nearly 3 years ago and there are almost certainly known security problems with it now.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Sending emails using the Amazon Simple Email Service
Post description: I've recently migrated the Moodle 2.0.2 enabled site I'm working on to a new server (new Amazon EC2 instance), and I notice that the emails sent from that new IP end up 83% of the time being marked as Spam , since the server is now white-listed ( yet ). Now, to counteract this, I'm looking into integrating Amazon Simple Email Service (SES) as the default emailing option. My take is to use Amazon-SES-Mailer-PHP - a d rop-in replacement of PHPMailer which sends email via Amazon SES . And here is where my questions come in: Has anybody tried so far to implement an alternative to the way Moodle sends out the emails? Are there any hints/guidelines for doing this? Would this be a good time for me to contribute back to Moodle and - when successfully solving this - to turn it into a plug in / module? If so, where should I start to learn how to contribute?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Marius, Thanks for sharing your plans - to be honest I think you are going about this the wrong way. I would recommend putting a local mta (exim/postfix) on your EC2 instance and configure that to send mail to SES. There seem to be a few gudies out there about configuring postfix/exim to do this if you google around. Then configure Moodle to talk plain old smtp to your local mailserver. This has the advantage of your local server doing the right thing if it can't contact the amazon service. I recommend this sort of setup for any resonable sized moodle site in any case because it just allows moodle to fire off the emails and forget whilst the mta does its job of managing the email delivery. I don't think there would be much interest in seeing this core for that reason (moodle just sends emails with plain old SMTP)
Comment 2: Personally I'd be very interested in this type of plugin. I'm moving a lot off apps to "cloud infrastructure" so it's be good to have multiple email providers configured in Moodle and it fall back from there. I'm currently trying to implement this by adapting these instructions to no avail. Have you had any luck? http://docs.moodle.org/22/en/Email_setup_gmail Ben
Comment 3: I've managed to connect to Moodle to Amazon SES through the SMTP settings. I followed these instructions: http://docs.moodle.org/22/en/Email_setup_gmail But used email-smtp.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:465 as the domain and the user and password I created in the Amazon Web Services console.
Comment 4: I've managed to connect to Moodle to Amazon SES through the SMTP settings. I followed these instructions: http://docs.moodle.org/22/en/Email_setup_gmail But used email-smtp.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:465 as the domain and the user and password I created in the Amazon Web Services console.
Comment 5: Ben: Could you describe the steps that you follow in order to make work Amazon SES. I have tried everything, included install postfix and I cant make it send mails.
Comment 6: The problem seems to be that moodle sets the sender email address to be the actual address of the sender. Hence Amazon will realize, in most cases, that the sender is not authenticated, and the message will not be delivered. A remedy to this is to hide the email addresses of all users. In this case moodle will use a default no-reply address as the sender. Assuming that this is set correctly, i.e., so that the no-reply address is of a verified domain, messages will get delivered. But one cannot reply to such messages.
Comment 7: I tried several approaches recomended by others - all worked to a point but had one drawback or another. Finally hit upon using emailrelay which is a simple SMTP relay.  Very simple to set up and works perfectly. yum -y install openssl-devel Download source for emailrelay ,  and compile with openssl so the encrypted connection to SES will work. ./configure --with-openssl make & make install I put my SES SMTP credentials (not amazon aws keys) into a file: eg /etc/amazon-ses as a single line thus: login client <username> <password> Then run email relay as service using the following... /usr/local/sbin/emailrelay --as-server --port 10025 --spool-dir /tmp/spool --poll 30 --forward-to email-smtp.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:587 --client-tls --client-auth /etc/amazon-ses --spool-dir /tmp/spool This will listen on port 10025 for incoming SMTP reqests, spool them to /tmp/spool and every 30 seconds attempt to send them through to amazon SES for delivery. Of course changing these settings is trivial. In centos I put this in /etc/rc.d/rc.local so it runs at startup. Check your machine is firewalled so external connections to port 10025 are not permitted. Then, within Moodle, I set up the email plugin to use SMTP address 127.0.0.1:10025 and no authentication details. One gotcha is that Moodle uses the 'support contact' email address as the sender (not the no-reply address), so this MUST be an address verified through your SES account with amazon. One of this benefits of this approach is that your Moodle PHP can 'send' email almost instantly - there is no pause waiting for SSL handshaking with a distant machine - and the emails are then spooled to be sent in an orderly way using a different process. This approach will also work with Gmail and avoids any core hacks. It only takes ten minutes to set up and seems rock solid (so far). My machine is on Amazon EC2 and Apache is Chrooted which created challenges for communicating with local MTA (no localhost). Hope it helps...
Comment 8: I have tried the the E-MailRelay method, but continue to receive the follow errors in .bad files. This is odd because I have both a verified domain and email address configure in AWS SES: ~~~~ X-MailRelay-Format: #2821.3 X-MailRelay-Content: 7bit X-MailRelay-From: verified@domain.edu X-MailRelay-ToCount: 1 X-MailRelay-To-Remote: student@someaddress.com X-MailRelay-Authentication: servername X-MailRelay-Client: 127.0.0.1 X-MailRelay-End: 1 X-MailRelay-Reason: smtp client failure: Message rejected: Email address is not verified. X-MailRelay-ReasonCode: 554
Comment 9: I have been working with Amazon EC2 based Moodles this semester and have been happy with everything until it hit the mail! I used Jango SMTP for a while, they had a nice mail relay service, and very little effort was envolved. But being hosted on the Amazon, I wanted to change over to the SES. And after a little head banging, I managed to get it working! Here is what I've done: 1. Signed up for the SES and created the auth key pair needed. 2. I decided to go with one email address that will be used for email, so I verified the email address I wanted to use with the SES. 3. Just for kicks I verified the domain also, which wasn't needed. Just by chance I may need it later. 4. Add the details to the Plugins -> Message Outputs -> Email. The address I used was email-smtp.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:587 This has the port number for TLS. 5. I enabled TLS and added the username and password auth details. 6. I updated the reply to address, to the one I verified. 7. Then I went to the support email address and updated it (admin/settings.php?section=supportcontact) to the verified email also. This is very important because this is the address things are often sent from!) And then It was ready to roll! Another little pointer was, ensure you have your cron set up, because things like the forum post emails rely on this! - Kyle.
Comment 10: This method though, has proved to show issues when emails are sent from user addresses, as they can not be verified, e.g. a gmail domain. So on further thought, the previous post of the mail relay may be worth a shot!
Comment 11: Just another little follow up on this. As each address needs to be verified by Amazon, which is impossible for student emails (e.g gmail.com addresses), Amazon will not allow it to be sent out. As a hack on this, inside the moodle/lib/moodlelib.php folder In this function: function email_to_user($user, $from, $subject, $messagetext, $messagehtml='', $attachment='', $attachname='', $usetrueaddress=true, $replyto='', $replytoname='', $wordwrapwidth=79) { global $CFG; $from = 'outgoingmailaddress@domain.com'; $replyto = 'outgoingmailaddress@domain.com'; I added those two lines just below the CFG, and that was the address I verified with the Amazon SES. Bit of a hack, because all mail goes though one address. But it works for cases when students send an email, which because it was from their address would otherwise be rejected by the Amazon SES for not being a verified send address.
Comment 12: I've been running Moodle on AWS for nearly 2 years, and email was the biggest headache until I discovered Critsend email relay service. It's not free, but incredibly cheap (and you get 50,000 mails for free to start you off). It will take you about 5 minutes to get Moodle on AWS setup to use critsend, and you get useful reports and statistics too (e.g. how many users open the emails sent). We've used them for 2 years now, sent about 500,000 emails and not had any problems. I wanted to use SES to keep it all in AWS, but it won't send on behalf of others, only on authorised email addresses - which isn't very suitable for Moodle.
Comment 13: Ian, Could you provide additional information on Critsend? I registered for the service, but for the last several days I get this message, " Your Account Is Pending Approval We will approve it in the next twenty four hours max. In case of emergencies, please contact us " Can you personally contact or get response from their Support team? Does the Support team respond to your emails? This is not a slam on the company. I am literally wondering if this is an anomoly or if the service is not viable. Also, are you aware of any other comparable services?
Comment 14: Same here. I keep getting the same message. Is there any altervative services for Critsend. Desperately seeking...

Forum Post: 
Post title: require_once($CFG->libdir.'/formslib'); don't works
Post description: Hello everyone! I am trying to create a form for my block, but I don't understanding where I'm wrong. My file form called sendmail_form.php and its class, called sendmail_form extends moodleform. But when I actualize the page this warming is displayed: Notice : Undefined variable: CFG in C:\xampp\htdocs\moodle\blocks\sendmail\sendmail_form.php on line 13 Notice : Trying to get property of non-object in C:\xampp\htdocs\moodle\blocks\sendmail\sendmail_form.php on line 13 Warning : require_once(/formslib.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in C:\xampp\htdocs\moodle\blocks\sendmail\sendmail_form.php on line 13 Fatal error : require_once(): Failed opening required '/formslib.php' (include_path='C:\xampp\php\ PEAR ') in C:\xampp\htdocs\moodle\blocks\sendmail\sendmail_form.php on line 13 Can you tell me where is the error? Thanks !
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: As the message suggests, the $CFG variable which you've tried to use in your require_once() call hasn't been defined. There are two ways to define $CFG: If you are in a function, you can start the function with global $CFG; If you are in a file that is accessed through the browser (rather than included/required in another file), it should always start with require(__DIR__ . '/../../config.php'); with as many ../ s as needed to make the path to config.php correct relative to the current file.
Comment 2: Now I see it, thanks a lot man!

Forum Post: 
Post title: USer authorisation with webservices
Post description: Is it possible to do something with user authorisation using webservices? I'm making a java client for moodle but I want to check if a user logging in is authorised to use my java client. When retrieving all users with the web service function `core_get_users` it doesn't return a password and so far i can't seem to find a webservice doing that. How can I check if a user is registered with the moodle installation?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: What you are actually asking is how to access Moodle to authenticate your local users. This is fraught with problems - depending how much you care about security. This is why horrible things like OAuth exist. Moodle doesn't know the user's password as it is hashed for security in the database . What you could do (and I've done it) is to write a (say) local plugin that exposes a new web service to authenticate a username and password passed to it. However, you need to think very hard if you really want to do that and how much you want to secure it.
Comment 2: I have little to no experience on developing in Moodle, is it possible that you can share your code with me?
Comment 3: Any code I have written is very client specific and wouldn't really help you. Sorry. There is some talk of developing an OAuth2 server plugin for Moodle. If this happens it should provide a solution to this sort of problem. At best, it will be several weeks away though.
Comment 4: Hmm, I can't really wait several weeks. Could you tell me the basics about creating a (local) plugin to expose a webservice to authenticate the user with a username and password passed to it? or link a tutorial/documentation on the matter
Comment 5: This is just one way... - Write a new local plugin ( https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Local_plugins ) - Add a page called authenticate.php to the plugin and get it to read two params - username and password. So, you'll end up with an endpoint something like http://your.moodle/local/auth/authenticate?username=fred&password=foo - The page calls authenticate_user_login( ... ) to verify the credentials. You can find it in lib/moodlelib.php and returns a result to your application - In your app, you use curl or similar to call the above endpoint and check the result This is about as simple as I can think of and has lots potentially wrong with it and there are several ways to do it better. Hopefully it gives you a clue. This sort of thing pays my rent so you'll understand why I can't be much more helpful.
Comment 6: Thanks! This will get me started at least.

Forum Post: Post title: How moodle create itemid for media files? Post description: Hello, I am using moodle 2.8 I have a question that how moodle convert draft itemid (temporary) into permanent itemid for any file I am observing that when I upload video file in lesson , it looks like draftfile.php?file=%2F1027%2Fuser%2Fdraft%2F 391340851 %2Ffilename.mp4 But same file showing in Code view of editor showing like

draftfile.php?file=%2F1027%2Fuser%2Fdraft%2F391340851%2Ffilename.mp4

in both line itemid has been change and second rows itemid that 248439929. I wants to know how itemid change of any file in moodle and in which mdl table it store. Comments associated with the post: Comment 1: The draftitemid is randomly generated each time you open up a form with a text editor / file manager element in it. This is only valid for the time between the form being displayed and the form being saved (actually, the draft areas persist for a couple of weeks, before being automatically deleted, but that is only because you can't tell if a form has been abandoned). When the form is saved, there will be some code (usually a call to file_postupdate_standard_editor or file_postupdate_standard_filemanager) which tells Moodle to transfer the files from the draft area into the specified real storage area (just like there will be a function call, usually file_prepare_standard_editor or file_prepare_standard_filemanager to populate the draft area before the form is displayed). There is no fixed mapping between draftitemid and real context / filearea / itemid / etc. - it is specific to the form being displayed and the code that handles it. Comment 2: So how can I get specific file which is used in lesson from database ? Comment 3: You'd have to look at the internal code of the Lesson activity to find out exactly where the files are stored. The details you need will be something like: contextid - the activity context component - "mod_lesson" file area - according to https://github.com/moodle/moodle/blob/master/mod/lesson/lib.php#L1310 the file areas used by lesson are "page_contents", "mediafile", "page_answers", "page_responses", "essay_responses" - so you will need to choose the appropriate area to get the file you want from itemid - that varies based on the file area you are getting details from - take a look at the lesson_pluginfile() function ( https://github.com/moodle/moodle/blob/master/mod/lesson/lib.php#L1261 ) to see what the different itemids mean Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Which is the best way to insert a javascript script?
Post description: Hi everyone! I'd developing a block that would contain a list of user "bookmarks" that will be used to jump to a certain part of a text within Moodle Book chapter. The block by itself is simple and jumpers will be created as simple <a href="#jump_to_bookmark_33"> elements. The question is what is the best way to insert a script that would contain a logic for new bookmarks creation (from text selection)? I see I can pass a script through the block I'm developing using $this -> page -> requires -> js_init_call(... or I can also inherit the theme and include the script using $THEME->javascripts_footer or any other idea? Which is the best? Thanks a lot - Hrvoje
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: $this->page->requires is the best method. (The various other methods are legacy things, that we really ought to be cleaned up and removed at some point.)
Comment 2: Thank you very much for your answer. I should do this that way then. Also, I was just wondering should I include this script within the block class or somewhere else? Where would it be? I'm asking because the block doesn't really need to exists for a functionality of "bookmarks" creation but only for "bookmarks" listing. In other words, the script for creation doesn't require block. But if there is no block, there will be no script. Hope I explained well. I'm really wondering. Thanks a lot. - Hrvoje
Comment 3: It is fine to put extra scripts in your block plugin (or any type of Moodle plugin). I just picked a block at random from the plugins DB: https://github.com/deraadt/moodle-block_progress , and that has a separate script overview.php .
Comment 4: Tnx

existing code) is accepted until beyond the release. This stabilisation
allows for QA testing and means developers are able to respond rapidly

Forum Post: 
Post title: recieving id from nuggets
Post description: Hello delevopers, I want to build a tool that functions like a knowlegemap where you can navigate between the courses up to the different learning nuggets. The only thing I cant solve is how I can link to the different nuggets. At the end of my map I want to link to the URL of the nugget. If I open a nugget the URL says view.php?id= and an identifier. But the Identifier does not seem to be saved in the database actually I cant find a value. Can somebody explain where the "id" in the URL does point to?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: What's a "learning nuggets"?
Comment 2: If the URL is [site]/course/view.php?id=XX, then the XX refers to a record in the mdl_course database table. If the URL is [site]/mod/[activitytype]/view.php?id=XX, then the XX refers to a record in the mdl_course_modules table. In that case, the 'module' field in that record will point to an entry in the table mdl_modules (which will have the name '[activitytype]', matching the URL) and the 'instance' field will refer to a record in the table 'mdl_[activitytype]' (again, matching the URL). See https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Course_module for more details.

Post description: Hi all - I am getting a failure with my mustache file validation that I cannot figure out. Specifically, the code: ﻿ 
```text
    Example 
context
 (json):


    {


        "respondentscolumn0": [


            "HTML of respondent link1",


            "HTML of respondent link2"


        ],


        "respondentscolumn1": [


            "HTML of respondent link3",


            "HTML of respondent link4"
```
 Is getting the error: 
```text
/home/travis/build/moodle/mod/questionnaire/templates/responselist.mustache - WARNING: HTML Validation error, line 5: Duplicate ID “respondentscolumn0”. (/div>
```
 <)
/home/travis/build/moodle/mod/questionnaire/templates/responselist.mustache - WARNING: HTML Validation info, line 3: The first occurrence of ID “respondentscolumn0” was here. (box"> <)
/home/travis/build/moodle/mod/questionnaire/templates/responselist.mustache - WARNING: HTML Validation error, line 9: Duplicate ID “respondentscolumn1”. (/div> <)

/home/travis/build/moodle/mod/questionnaire/templates/responselist.mustache - WARNING: HTML Validation error, line 13: Duplicate ID “respondentscolumn2”. (/div> <)

Forum Post: 
Post title: duplicating a module
Post description: I would like to duplicate a module and make my own change on it. What would I have to replace in order it to work? It is sure that I need to change all the DB tables names, and the path name from module to newmodule. What else should I take in account? global settings variables? Do I need to rename all the functions name? Or it is ok that 2 modules will have the same functions name? Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Whenever I do this, I make the following changes: rename the main directory (/mod/oldname => /mod/newname) rename the language file (/mod/newname/lang/en/oldname.php => /mod/newname/lang/en/newname.php) search and replace all references to the original name throughout the code (preserving the original case, to make the comments read a bit better). This step can be more difficult if the module name is also used in other contexts, e.g. with the ' URL ' module, you need to be careful to not rename all 'moodle_url' references. Tweak the version.php file to reference today's date (optional). Step 3 should manage to fix the names of the database tables, plus all references to them. Theoretically, you might be able to get away without renaming some of the functions. However, most functions in /mod/newname/lib.php must match the name of the module, otherwise Moodle won't be able to find the function it needs to call. Also, you should assume that (at the very least) the lib.php, version.php and settings.php files for all modules will sometimes be in memory at the same time, so any functions with the same names in those files will cause problems. In practice, this means that using your IDE's 'search and replace in multiple files' function is the best way to proceed.
Comment 2: Thanks a lot! I am trying to duplicate the scorm module.
Comment 3: After changing the "scorm" to "cetplugin" and installing the plugin. After adding an activity of the new moduled, I get the following errors(I have renamed the file scormlib.php to cetplugin.php): Warning: require_once(/var/www/html/moodle25/mod/cetplugin/datamodels/cetpluginlib.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in /var/www/html/moodle25/mod/cetplugin/locallib.php on line 251 Call Stack: 0.0007 819480 1. {main}() /var/www/html/moodle25/course/modedit.php:0 0.3339 57127584 2. add_moduleinfo() /var/www/html/moodle25/course/modedit.php:269 0.3974 57176632 3. cetplugin_add_instance() /var/www/html/moodle25/course/modlib.php:98 0.4493 57331608 4. cetplugin_parse() /var/www/html/moodle25/mod/cetplugin/lib.php:157 Fatal error: require_once(): Failed opening required '/var/www/html/moodle25/mod/cetplugin/datamodels/cetpluginlib.php' (include_path='/var/www/html/moodle25/lib/zend:/var/www/html/moodle25/lib/ pear :.:/usr/share/pear:/usr/share/php') in /var/www/html/moodle25/mod/cetplugin/locallib.php on line 251 Call Stack: 0.0007 819480 1. {main}() /var/www/html/moodle25/course/modedit.php:0 0.3339 57127584 2. add_moduleinfo() /var/www/html/moodle25/course/modedit.php:269 0.3974 57176632 3. cetplugin_add_instance() /var/www/html/moodle25/course/modlib.php:98 0.4493 57331608 4. cetplugin_parse() /var/www/html/moodle25/mod/cetplugin/lib.php:157

Post title: Removal of calendar_event_hook()
Post description: This hook (specified in https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Calendar_API#Event_hook ) is being removed in 3.3 by MDL-57578 . This hook was added without much explanation. Developers should be using the Moodle events system to achieve this behaviour, not use this hacky calendar specific implementation. Events will be added in MDL-55611 for 3.3 which you can use if you wish to be notified of the hide/show calender event action.

Post title: How to validate profile data before it gets saved to database?
Post description: I would like my authentication plugin to validate user profile data before it gets saved. I've found out two hooks related to updating one's profile: 1. The core\event\user_updated event This unfortunately happens after the data has already been saved. 2. Call to authplugin->update_user() This code in user/edit.php would allow my authentication plugin to do its stuff before user gets updated: 
```text
    // Pass a true old $user here.
    if (!$authplugin->user_update($user, $usernew)) {
        // Auth update failed.
        print_error('cannotupdateprofile');
    }
```
 ...the problem however is that this affects only the users created using my own plugin, and I would like the validation to be triggered for all users. Is there a way to somehow force the validation feature for all accounts? (The use case is that I want to prevent using the same phone number in more than one user account.)
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Bump...
Comment 2: It seems a bit confusing that you use external auth for some account but want to enforce data integrity across moodle.  What if your external database sets the same phone number as another moodle account? But based on the use case, I would consider hiding any existing phone number field and adding a separate unique phone number field as a profile extension. That can be done in the gui. Are there any reasons this would not be suitable?
Comment 3: My auth plugin allows any user to request a new password via SMS. So m y goal is to specifically prevent duplicate phone numbers. No matter where they are coming from. I'd prefer not to extend the profile with a non-default field. The plugin does much more that just resets passwords. Therefore I'm afraid using an extra field would complicate things. (I may be wrong about that, though?)
Comment 4: You can always create custom profile field plugin that will offer a chance to validate anything before saving. See https://docs.moodle.org/dev/User_profile_fields

Post description: Hi, I have been using the Reload editor for some time to build SCORM packages, but I am a sequencing n000b, being completely new to the sequencing feature. I have been googling and doing some research, and I understand the concept, but am at a loss to the nomenclature, as well as the technical implementation. My paradigm: In Reload, I have a SCORM 2004 package with 6 SCO's: - Welcome - Module 1 - Module 1 - Module 1 - Module 1 - Conclusion I have loaded this up on our in-house LMS and can see that the SCO's are passed individually, so this all works fine. However, I can access any of the SCOs at any time.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: As an aside per my question, how would you all go about doing this, if you're not using the Reload editor? I'm pretty sure I could adopt any paradigm, if I just understood what rules to implement...
Comment 2: Hi, I just wanted to say that I found my answer, and in case this helps anyone else out, here's how I solved my issue: 1. Go to: http://scorm.com/scorm-explained/technical-scorm/golf-examples/ 2. Under the "Sequencing Examples", download : Forced Sequential Order (Prerequisites) [Complete Example] 3. Open In Reload Editor 4. Place your Reload project side by side with the Forced Sequential Order example 5. Replicate the Forced Sequential Order within your project 6. Zip up, done. Cheers, Chip

So, I want to import those packages in Reload editor and do sequencing. Is it possible? Will this solve my problem of sequencing and export final version to the Moodle ? Thanks, Sree

Forum Post: 
Post title: Course Overview Block CSS
Post description: This is super simple, I'm sure of it. But I'm new to this and appreciate any direction. I'm trying to change the css of the course overview block. (Completion graph colors mostly.) I'm having trouble finding where to do this. I've read I should be creating a styles.css file into the main file of the plugin. Have this started, but looking for how to determine what the completion graph is tied to when progress is marked as true beyond 0%. Anything above 0% progress, the graph changes colors, and that is the specific thing I'm trying to change.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Katy So you'll need to use the following rule overrides to change the completion charts: 
```text
/* This is the base colour of the doughnut chart - i.e. progress remaining */
div.block-myoverview .progress-chart-container .progress-doughnut {
  border: 15px solid #f00; /* will override base colour with red */
}

/* This is the completion colour of the doughnut chart - i.e. progress made */
div.block-myoverview .progress-chart-container .progress-doughnut .progress-indicator svg .circle {
  stroke: #00f; /* will display progress as blue segment */


}
```
 Depending on which theme you are using, you may be able to place these rules into the theme settings (e.g. Boost has a raw scss setting) or you may need to add them to the theme css file. Hope that helps. Best Raad ~~ Raad Al-Rawi Moodle Technical Developer/DBA University of Cambridge, UK

```text
FROM prefix_user_enrolments AS ue

JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c.id = e.courseid


JOIN prefix_user AS user2 ON user2.id = ue.userid

JOIN prefix_groups g ON g.courseid = c.id


JOIN prefix_groups_members AS m ON m.userid = user2.id AND g.id = m.groupid
```

Forum Post: 
Post title: SQL: Dynamic table names for course modules in a sql query
Post description: I'm not sure if this is possible. I am trying to improve a BI Dashboard plugin I have made, trying to minimise the amount of processing power and DB calls it makes. Currently to get the activity instance record I do this 
```text
$
sql
 = "SELECT cm.id, cm.instance, m.name 


 FROM {course_modules} cm


 INNER JOIN {modules} m ON m.id = cm.module


 WHERE m.name <> 'label' AND cm.id IN (".$course_activities.")";

$course_modules = $DB->get_records_sql($sql, null);

foreach ($course_modules as $cmkey => $course_module) {

    $activity_instance = $DB->get_record($course_module->name, array('id'=>$course_module->instance));
.....
.....
}
```
 Is there a way that I can include the activity instance in the first query. ie. Something like: 
```text
$sql = "SELECT cm.id, cm.instance, m.name, a.name


FROM {course_modules} cm


INNER JOIN {modules} m ON m.id = cm.module


INNER JOIN {m.name} a ON a.id = cm.instance


WHERE m.name <> 'label' AND cm.id IN (".$course_activities.")";
```
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi David, no that sort of thing isn't possible in SQL. It sounds like you could probably get the data you're looking for using get_fast_modinfo(), though - have you tried that? You may well get the data from the cache, so it wouldn't hit the database at all.
Comment 2: Thanks Michael. No, I didn't know about get_fast_modinfo(), it's very helpful!
Comment 3: More generically, and assuming direct DB access is needed, you could build one query in a loop (whether hitting the DB directly is better or worse than using the caching functions will depend on whether or not you mostly hit or miss cache). For example (pseudo-code!): $config = array('<tablename>' => '<fieldname>', ...); $sql = array(); foreach ($config as $table => $field) { $sql[] = "SELECT {$table}.$field  AS <commonname> FROM {$table} WHERE ...."; } $sql = implode($sql, " UNION "); $DB->get_XXX($sql, ...); I've used this approach when needing to get counts of activities with a given deadline, as the deadline field is a per-activity-type one not per-activity, and the relevant field name changes between types. Phil
Comment 4: This might give you an idea https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=153059#p1166404

Forum Post: 
Post title: Prvious URL ...
Post description: Hi everybody, I created a form to send e-mail, usable by all the users connected or not. I would like to add to the content of the e-mail the URL of the previous page. Sometimes it could be useful to have it. Is this possible? If so, how ? Thanks in advance for your answers. Best regards, Baptiste.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You can get the URL of the referring page (the page from which you clicked a link to get to the current one) in PHP like this: 
```text
$url = $_SERVER['HTTP_REFERER'];
```
 However, there are a few caveats, see http://php.net/manual/en/reserved.variables.server.php
Comment 2: ...and you are generally recommended not to do that sort of thing. Moodle has a library function... 
```text
/**


 * Returns the URL of the HTTP_REFERER, less the querystring portion if required.


 *


 * @param boolean $stripquery if true, also removes the query part of the url.


 * @return string The resulting referer or empty string.


 */


function get_referer($stripquery=true) {
```
Comment 3: Hi, Thanks for your answers. The function get_referer did the work. Best regards, Baptiste Lhoste

Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: For my understanding: You prepare a style sheet in SCSS/SASS http://sass-lang.com/ and add them to two Moodle sites. One site, in the localhost, responds the other, a remote one, doesn't. Right?
Comment 2: How are you referencing the image? If you are using the logo setting to upload it, then the url link will be different between your localhost and your online versions anyway. Also the logo setting file upload is more suited to having the image identified in the layout file using php code to get the setting content back. If you are adding the image using SCSS, and you have access to the theme files, you would be better off adding it to the pix folder of your theme and then being able to reference it properly as shown in many of the theme tutorials.
Comment 3: Hi, Can I ask what theme you are using, as this could be the problem? Thanks Mary

Post title: Only lowercase letters allowed ?
Post description: I have moodle 2.8.3 . When I update the user profile I get the error "Only lowercase letters allowed" because some character in my usernames are in Uppercase. Uppercase doesn't disturb my login page. I can login in Lowercaps. Thanks Kathir Rajaraman
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Kathir - I don't think this is really a "development" question. This is really more of a Moodle admin and usage question, and should probably have been posted in another forum such as the " General / General help " forum. That said, I believe you need to configure your site to allow extended characters in usernames. This setting is in your "Site administration / Security / Site policies" settings page as "Allow extended characters in usernames". mike
Comment 2: Hi Mike Thanks for reply post. Sure i will post to General forum. "Allow extended characters in usernames" this option already i enabled. But Still now not working. Thanks Kathir
Comment 3: Looks like you are right. The code definitely limits usernames to lowercase only. "Allow extended characters in usernames" does not impact that limitation. According to MDL-47593 , this is intentional. mike

good way!). At the same time we are still finding little visual or
functional problems and we would really like to fix them before the
release. Developers and testers are already welcome to download Moodle 3.2RC2 from either download page or official GIT repository or it's mirror on github . However

production by the end of this week and we want to move the release date
to 5 December 2016 . We appreciate your patience and hope that you will welcome all the hard work of our developers.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Patch for MDL-15187; What do I do with it?
Post description: Hi, I've not contributed to Moodle code before. I've produced a patch to do a minimal fix for MDL-15187 (attached). How do I submit it please? Thanks Stephen Parry
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You did the right thing by attaching the patch to the tracker issue. I would be even better if you could turn the patch into a git commit ( https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Git_for_developers ). There is a catch 22: Until you have submitted your first patch and had it accepted, you don't have permission to do anything else. Once your first patch is accepted, then you get more tracker permissions, including a 'Submit for peer review' button. If you don't have access to that button, you may be able to add a 'patch' label to the tracker issue, but I just did that.

Post title: How to deny a particular student by accessing a block?
Post description: Hi, i just created a block in moodle 2.9. And is there any possible way for deny a particular student by accessing that block? eg. suppose there are 100 students attending a course. And in that course there is a block named study meterials. And i want to block a particular student by  accessing that course
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello, One way would be to create a new role with block ticked as context type where the role may be assigned and the view block capability set to prohibit. You can then assign the role to the user in the block context. Please see the documentation Creating custom roles and Assign roles for more details.

Comments associated with the post:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle 2.8.5+:How to set new block access rules?
Post description: Hello, I am developing a new block. I added it's instance to the page, but there is two problems: 1- after turn editing off it will disappear. 2- after logging out as a user it will disappear. I think the problem is related to db/access.php I like the block to be sticky an shown to every body: users, guests, etc. So how I can solve this problem?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: If its disappearing when you turn editing off make sure it's actually outputting some content for users. That's the most common reason that I find when I've written blocks. Also make sure that your site's configuration hasn't been changed to not include the "moodle/block:view" capability for any roles. "Sticky" doesn't typically mean an assocation with a target audience, sticky historically has more of a idea of the block appearing permanently on pages. If you want the block to be sticky its more down to how you add the block the site, rather than something you do in development. So go to the "highest" place that that the block can be added (for example the front page , some blocks restrict what pages they can be added to) Add an instance of the block open the block configuration In the "Where this block appears" set an option. and default region and weight. The block should now appear on each page that matches the context you selected. You can use this to make a block appear on every course page too. Set the "Display throughout entire site" Go into a course Configure the block Set a context, which will be limited to course pages. (of course this causes it to disappear off the pages that don't match the context selected).

```text
SELECT ue.userid, ue.enrolid,
    MIN(xpue.status + xpe.status) AS pstatus,
    MIN(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0) THEN xpue.timestart ELSE 9999999999 END) AS ptimestart,
    MAX(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0) THEN
        (CASE WHEN xpue.timeend = 0 THEN 9999999999 ELSE xpue.timeend END)
        ELSE 0 END) AS ptimeend
FROM mdl_user_enrolments ue
    JOIN mdl_enrol e ON (e.id = ue.enrolid AND e.enrol = 'meta' )
    JOIN mdl_user_enrolments xpue ON (xpue.userid = ue.userid)
    JOIN mdl_enrol xpe ON (xpe.id = xpue.enrolid AND xpe.enrol <> 'meta'
        AND xpe.enrol IN ('manual', 'cohort', 'meta') AND xpe.courseid = e.customint1)
GROUP BY ue.userid, ue.enrolid
HAVING (MIN(xpue.status + xpe.status) = 0 AND MIN(ue.status) > 0)
    OR (MIN(xpue.status + xpe.status) > 0 AND MIN(ue.status) = 0)
    OR ((CASE WHEN MIN(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0)
         THEN xpue.timestart ELSE 9999999999 END) = 9999999999
         THEN 0 ELSE MIN(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0)
         THEN xpue.timestart ELSE 9999999999 END) END) <> MIN(ue.timestart))
    OR ((CASE 
         WHEN MAX(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0)
             THEN (CASE WHEN xpue.timeend = 0 THEN 9999999999 ELSE xpue.timeend END)
             ELSE 0 END) = 9999999999
         THEN 0 ELSE MAX(CASE WHEN (xpue.status + xpe.status = 0)
         THEN (CASE WHEN xpue.timeend = 0
             THEN 9999999999 ELSE xpue.timeend END)
         ELSE 0 END) END) <> MAX(ue.timeend))
```
 I'm trying to verify it works on those two databases to hopefully improve performance of a meta enrollment query: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-43176

Post title: Orpahned activities in Moodle 3.3
Post description: We are upgrading our  Moodle instance from version 3.1 to 3.3. We have many courses (more than 100) with orphaned activities (hundreds of them) . I understand that after the upgrade their sections will be visible. I've read about Stealth_activities , but it's not feasible for us to do the conversion one activity at a time for so many activities and courses. Is there a script, or DB query, that can help us do this in bulk? Alternatively, I see that in the get_last_section_number function in course/format/lib.php there is a check for $course->numsections: 
```text
$course = $this->get_course();


if (isset($course->numsections)) {


    return $course->numsections;


}
```
 But I event though these courses do have numsections defined in the DB, the check returns FALSE because apparently the code does'n't return them. Is there any way I can override some function and make the check return TRUE?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Lea, can you please explain what are you trying to convert?
Comment 2: Hi Marina, Thanks for your answer. I'll try to explain: In our Moodle, which is run on version 3.1, we have courses in which there are many sections, but only a few of them are displayed. The rest of the sections have activities in them, and they are linked to from the visible sections (there were pedagogical reasons for building the sections  that way). The hiding of the rest of the sections is done by using the numsections attribute in the course. For example, one of our courses has 6 sections, but numsections is set to 0 since all the activities in those sections are reached via links from the first section. Now, we want to upgrade our Moodle to 3.3, and in that version, the numsections attribute is obsolete, which means that all those "orpahned" sections are now visible. If we want to keep them hidden, we have to go section by section and hide the sections, and then, for each activity, we have to make it available via the edit menu. That's a lot of manual work, and I was wondering whether either of the following options is possible: Is there a script, or DB query, that can help us do this in bulk? I see that the `get_last_section_number` function in course/format/lib.php still has a check for $course->numsections, but it returns false (I quoted the code in my original question). Is there any way to override some function and make the check return TRUE? Thank you
Comment 3: Hi Lea, Your message confused me so I have actually installed 3.1, created a course in it and then upgraded to 3.3 to check what happens. As I expected, the sections that contained orphaned activities became invisible . However you say: 
```text
Now, we want to upgrade our Moodle to 3.3, and in that version, the 
numsections attribute is obsolete, which means that all those "orpahned"
 sections are now visible.
```
 I do not see it. These sections are hidden and they should be hidden. Activities inside them are "stealth" which means that students can access them by following the URL - exactly the way orphaned activities used to behave. At the same time the course settings the setting "Hidden sections" by default is "Hidden sections are shown in collapsed form". So the names of the hidden sections are shown to the students - they see something like "Topic 3 is not available". Can you please confirm that you see the same? If so, try going to the course settings and, under "Course format" section, change "Hidden sections" to "Hidden sections are completely invisible". Will this solve the issue for you?
Comment 4: Hi Marina, Wow, thank you so much for going to all that trouble! I tried to follow your instructions regarding the "Hidden sections" setting, but unfortunately that didn't help. I do think there might be a difference in the way I upgraded the system: I installed a fresh 3.3, made some modifications (mainly a theme and a few plugins), and then attached it to the DB of the 3.1 instance we had. Then I logged into the Moodle, and the system upgraded the DB. Do you think that could that explain the different behavior in the hidden sections? Thank you
Comment 5: Hi Marina I decided to check the upgrade doing it the way you described: upgrading the same site instead of creating a new site. I ran 2 tests, and I have conflicting results. The first test: Installed a fresh copy of Moodle 3.1 Imported from our site 3 courses which have orphaned sections. The import was successful, the sections stayed orphaned. Switched branch ( git ) and got latest version of 3.3 from Moodle on Github Installed (via FTP or CLI) a couple of course formats and themes that the courses needed. Went to the site and did the upgrade process successfully The sections became hidden and their activities are available to students. Success! The second test: On our current site (3.1) I switched branch (git) and got latest version of 3.3 from Moodle on Github Installed (via FTP or CLI) all formats, themes, question types, etc. and assorted plugins that the courses needed. Went to the site and did the upgrade process successfully The sections stayed visible. Failure . Since the process of getting the 3.3 version was the same in both tests, and the change was in the plugins installed (in the first test only about 5 plugins were installed, but in the second test we installed dozens of plugins), I'm thinking that some plugin was at fault. I don't know which plugin, and the process of elimination would be too tedious, but just updating this info here, in case someone has an insight on the issue.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Application cache store value should be reinitialized in case of Apache restart
Post description: Hi, I have implemented local plugin that initialize an instance of RabbitMQ consumer for Moodle 2.6. There should always be only one instance of consumer for the whole application running in the background. After 300 seconds or 100 consumed messages, consumer terminates and new consumer is created. Since I don't want administrator to run cron job to trigger consumer , and Task API is not available for Moodle 2.6, my approach to trigger consumer for the first time is to check in my event observer if consumer is running and start it if not. I used Moodle application cache store to store the value "consumer_enabled" to true or false, to prevent trigger to create new consumer if there is already one running in the background. It works fine, except when Apache is restarted. In that case, consumer terminates, but value in store remains true, so after Apache starts, my trigger will not initialize consumer again. Hope somebody have idea how to solve this problem, or suggest some other approach that would work better in my scenario. Thanks Zoran

Post title: Form elements in form elements
Post description: Hello, With Moodle 3.3 can I add form elements to other form elements?  So with reference to https://docs.moodle.org/dev/lib/formslib.php_Form_Definition#radio - could I create two radio groups and have the second 'within' the first's 'radio'?  So... to have: (o) Option one: (o) Option one one. (o) Option one two. (o) Option one three [text input]. (o) Option two: [text input] [select input]. Thus only have 'Option one ...' active when 'Option one' is clicked on.  And have radio elements with appended select / text inputs? I'm an experienced Moodler but stumped on this one! Thanks, Gareth
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello, After many hours I found out that its impossible to have a Form group within a form group in the Moodle forms API and standard HTML markup does not allow elements within radio inputs.  I've gone for a checkbox / radio solution with disabledIf logic.  It did find out though that disabledIf does not work well with two radio groups within an addGroup.  All being well when the job is done the code will be within a plugin on Moodle.org for all to see. Cheers, Gareth

Comment 1: Hi Mian The form data is return as an object: 
```text
object
(
stdClass
)[
1204
]
  
public
 'courseid' => 
    
array
 
(size=2)

      0 =>  '3' 
(length=1)

      1 =>  '2' 
(length=1)

(length=1)

(length=5)

```
 The selected courses are in an array, which can't be directly inserted into the database . You need to process this data first. This is often done with an explicitly created object for insertion into the database. For example: 
```text
$todb = new stdClass();


$todb->courses = implode(',', $formdata->courseid);


$todb->username = $formdata->username;


$DB->insert_record('table', $todb);
```
 There are examples of this throughout core Moodle code, which you should examine to figure out ways to improve your code.

Post title: Overriding a core class
Post description: Dear all, I would like to have the list of my blog entries printed with titles only, without the actual entry body. The body of a particular entry will be visible only after clicking on a title and viewing a particular entry. I guess I need to override a moodle core class to achieve this. This class is probably blog_listing located in blog/locallib.php and the function to override is print_entries(). I know how to override a renderer and I read a lot of docs about renderers but it seems that in this case I have to do anything else and override a specific class, not a renderer. Any suggestions?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: OK, I suppose I can not override moodle core class. But there is another way to prevent showing of blog entries contents on a page where blog entries are listed. I can override a blog renderer and check if entryid parameter exists in the request. So I changed the code: 
```text
// Body.


$o .= format_text($entry->summary, $entry->summaryformat, array('overflowdiv' => true));
```
 into 
```text
// Body.


if (optional_param('entryid', 0, PARAM_INT) > 0)


$o .= format_text($entry->summary, $entry->summaryformat, array('overflowdiv' => true));
```
 and it works.

Post title: Suggested feature - hidden but available courses
Post description: Hi all, I don't know if this is the appropriate forum for suggesting features ... if not, sorry! There is a great feature that will be available in 3.3 that will allow resources and activities to be available to students but not immediately visible to them ( MDL-4782 in the Tracker ) I think this would be something that would be useful at course level aswell. Say for example I have a course page that has resources/activities that I want students in several other courses to be able to access. I only want one instance each of the resources because, of course, I only want to have to edit them once. If I enrol the users to give them access to the resources, they will see this course in their list of courses on their dashboard . I don't want them to see it though in 'my courses', as I only want them to see their 'official' list of courses. If I could keep the course  'hidden' but available I could achieve this. Unless there's an existing way of doing this? Should I raise a tracker? I'm not a developer so would not be able to contribute practically myself (except for testing). Thanks Catherine
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I think you can already do this, just by making the course open to guests - users wouldn't see it in their My Courses list, but would have access to any of the content if linked to it.
Comment 2: I can confirm it works well, we use it to share content (ressources) on several courses. But, it means that this course (content) is usable by anybody having an account on your Moodle, which isn't always something you really want. Talking about activities, i don't see how such a thing could be used... because students have to be enroled in course. So, having a state of usable (but not visible on Dashbord) could be helpful.

Oh further there is to say we have no permission to modify core files of moodle directly. Greetings some students ;)

Post title: solr create scheme error
Post description: Hello! Can you help me? After solr installation i have this error: Solr: Field 'itemid': Field type 'int' not found. Debug info: Error code: errorcreatingschema Stack trace: line 308 of /search/engine/solr/classes/schema.php: moodle_exception thrown line 202 of /search/engine/solr/classes/schema.php: call to search_solr\schema->validate_add_field_result() line 120 of /search/engine/solr/classes/schema.php: call to search_solr\schema->add_fields() line 55 of /search/engine/solr/setup_schema.php: call to search_solr\schema->setup()
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Ivan, which version of Moodle and which version of solr? Guessing MDL-60759 here, w/o any further info. HTH , Matteo
Comment 2: moodle 3.2+ (Build: 20161222) solr 7.2.1
Comment 3: Hi Ivan, moodle 3.2+ (Build: 20161222) solr 7.2.1 OK, that's the issue: you need 3.5 AKA DEV to work with solr 7.x. HTH, Matteo
Comment 4: Hello, I was using moodle 3.2+ solr 5.5.3 but I do not recommend it. My server has been hacked due to a failure in SOLR (up to version 7.1) .. but moodle up to 3.4 is not compatible with solr 7.2 correct? See this case: https://morphuslabs.com/apache-solr-the-new-target-for-cryptominers-6e852fcf5543 ""The flaw (CVE-2017–12629) [2] first announced October 12th 2017, affects Apache SOLR version 7.1 and below. Due to an incorrectly configured XML parser in the “queryparser” library, attackers can get access to sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on vulnerable systems. In this moment i disable global search in my moodle.
Comment 5: Hi Gisele, while the statement about Moodle 3.4 compatibility is still valid, I wonder how your SOLR server has been configured: you could&should limit network visibility to let your SOLR instance be consumed only by the Moodle instance, without exposing it to others; Moodle won't damage the SOLR instance unless the server where the Moodle code has been installed will be hacked too - but you'll have other problems at that point. Could be firewalling an option here? HTH, Matteo
Comment 6: Hello Matteo I used this tutorial to install and configure SOLR : https://docs.moodle.org/32/en/Global_search#Setting_up_Solr My Moodle code is intact.. no problem... Do you have any indication of how to configure SOLR for localhost access only? This is corret? https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8924102/restricting-ip-addresses-for-jetty-and-solr thank you
Comment 7: Hi Gisele, binding SOLR to localhost is what you need if everything runs on the same machine: none outside the machine could connect on it: unfortunately, that configuration looks like not a binding but a whitelist which is not the same thing but will work until bugs on the module implementing the whitelist. I'd try playing w/ https://daniel.hepper.net/blog/2012/04/restricting-ip-addresses-for-solr-with-jetty/ too ( http://deeb.me/20160223/bind-solr-5-5-to-localhost ). The Moodle docs covers the installation of the software not the security policies to be applied since they are specific to your environment and usually any OS starts with a basic but nice firewall configuration, enabled by default: do you have the chance to enable a local software firewall opening just HTTP/S and SSH and nothing else? HTH, Matteo

Forum Post: 
Post title: Licensing/code implications of distributing external file chooser with plugin code
Post description: Hello all. I'm working on a repository plugin which uses an external web service to provide the file chooser (similar to the Equella plugin). However, to keep the plugin installation simple, I'm considering bundling the web service with the plugin code. In effect, the plugin's external file chooser will be available at http://moodle_url/repository/myplugin/service. (It can still be deployed externally, if desired, though.) Does this have any licensing or code checking implications? The web service code, while distributed with the plugin, is effectively a third party library when used this way. Do the usual Moodle code review processes apply to that code? Does it need to by GPL v3 licensed, or is that only required for the piece of code which calls the web service to load the external file chooser? Do I need to worry about whether the web service code uses libraries which replicate code in Moodle core (I'd prefer the web service to be independent of Moodle, so I don't really want to use Moodle's libraries, and would prefer to use those of my own choosing which I control)? Thanks. Elliot Smith
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I can provide some answers to your licensing questions, with the usual caveat that if you're not certain of your legal position you should speak to a lawyer who specialised in copyright licensing. The answers to your questions depend on the ownership of the web service code, and what you intend to do with it. Do you own the copyright on the third party code (in which case you can license it however you wish)? Are you planning to distribute the resulting plugin, or just use it internally? (if you're not distributing it, and your usage is within the terms of the license, it doesn't matter.) If the third party code is owned by someone else, and you want to distribute the resulting plugin, then you need to look at how the third party code is licensed.  If it uses the GPL or a permissive open source license (such as BSD, MIT or Apache ), then that license allows you to distribute it however you wish, including as part of a GPL codebase (as long as you provide the necessary attribution etc). The only real issues would be if it's released under a proprietary license, or a license that's open source but not GPL-compatible .
Comment 2: Thanks for the response, Mark. I own the web service code, and the intention is to release it under Apache v2 (GPL compatible). Ideally, I'd like to add the plugin to the Moodle plugins registry. In that situation, I would bundle the plugin code (GPL v3) along with all its dependencies (including my web service) in the plugin download . (This seems to be the way Moodle plugins work - there's no way to install dependencies other than packaging them into the plugin zip file, unless I've missed something.) To clarify, providing I treat my own web service code as third party code (as it can run standalone as a PHP app), do I have to apply the Moodle coding guidelines to that code? Or can I write it how I like and pull it into my plugin as a dependency (as long as the licensing is OK)? Thanks.
Comment 3: I'm not an expert on this area, but do a search of the codebase for files called thirdpartylibs. xml . These are used by various components do define any libraries they include, along with their licenses. They're also used by tools like grunt to exclude these libraries from automated checks.  Adding one of these files to your plugin and listing your web service code in it will make it clear that you're including separate code under the Apache v2 license.

Post title: UnEnroll API slow on bulk un-enrollments in clustered configuration
Post description: Hi, The MySQL clustering configuration we have is full two way synchronized replication across US and EU servers.   We know this is a bit of bottleneck on bulk operations after profiling. Specifically when we programmatically un-enroll bunch of users in US, depending on the number users, it can take up to 30 minutes to unEnroll in this configuration which in turn results in the My SQL transactions having to also do the same in EU. We are calling the enrol_plugin->unenroll_user( x, y)  for every user. This API in turn calls bunch of other apis which include queries, deletes, etc. which the MySQL replication is choking on. My question is: is there a batch unEnroll api that we can pass the user id's, course id  to that would do this in bulk and be faster ? If not, is there a update SQL that we can run instead to do the same thing that we can simply call. Thanks A

Forum Post: 
Post title: adding capablities for a new role
Post description: hi using the access.php I tried to do this: $capabilities = array( 'moodle/test_user:viewhiddenusers' => array( 'captype' => 'read', 'contextlevel' => CONTEXT_COURSE, 'archetypes' => array( 'manager' => CAP_ALLOW, 'editingteacher' => CAP_ALLOW, 'myrole' => CAP_ALLOW, ) ), ); 'myrole' is a role I created. I got the following error: "Error code: invalidlegacy" in the database I see that the capabilities were insterted to all the roles others than 'myrole'. can anyone tell me what I did wrong ?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The 'archetypes' list is just that, a list of base 'archetypes' that roles can be created based on - if you go to site admin > users > permissions > define roles and click on a role, then it will tell you the archetype it is based on. For the built-in roles the archetype has the same name as the role, for custom roles they will (usually) inherit from one of the built-in archetypes. The list of archetypes is (unless I'm mistaken) hard-coded into Moodle, but if your custom role inherits from one of these archetypes, then it will gain the capabilities assigned to that archetype.
Comment 2: thanks but how do I prevent this "Error code: invalidlegacy" error when I try to insert capabilities via the access.php file ?
Comment 3: OK, I guess I should have been a bit clearer in my last message. You can avoid the error message 'invalid legacy' error messages from access.php, by only using one of the hard-coded list of archetypes: manager coursecreator editingteacher teacher student guest user frontpage As stated in my original message, if you have a custom role and you want that custom role to have a specific capability, then you need to make sure that custom role is based on one of the built-in archetypes, then assign that capability to the archetype.

Post title: Datadirectory hosted on other centos machine
Post description: Hi All, I am using Moodle 2.7 which is installed in centos machine. I have two centos machine (VMs) (machine 1 and machine 2) . I have installed Moodle 2.7 on both the machine. But I want to use DB and Data direcotry(moodledata) of machine 1 into machine 2. In config.php file of machine 2, I have set DB Host and other details of machine 1. But I don't know how do I set the data directory of centos machie 2. Please help me. Your help will be highly appreciated. Thanks in advance.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Can anyone help me pls?
Comment 2: NFS mount point on machine 2 that points to appropriate directories on machine 1.  Please see: https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-set-up-an-nfs-mount-on-centos-6 But, have to ask ... what's the purpose?  How do you plan to use machine 2?  Are both machines to be accessible via the net (internal/private as well as public internet)?  A setup like this, may not render desired results (depending). 'spirit of sharing', Ken
Comment 3: Perhaps he's doing load balancing? Having Moodledata on a separate folder is necessary in a load balanced setup. You have multiple web servers running the Moodle code, a database server running the database and a file server for Moodledata. Your network connection between all those servers just needs to be really fast.

Post title: Events and Event handlers
Post description: Hello moodlers, I have read the Events API documentations many times. But I could not get the information what I am looking for. Can anybody explain how we can use events listed in Events API page. How we can use/customise listed events there. Are they available already or we need to work on top of that. Any information would be really helpful. Many thanks, Dinesh.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: One example is in the quiz. The quiz triggers a 'quiz_attempt_submitted' event when a student submits a quiz attempt. It also listens for that event, and when it recieves one, it sends the notification emails. (This is so that if an error occurs when sending the email, it will not prevent the attempts being submitted.) Another example is in forum. The forum recieves user_enrolled and user_unenrolled events in order to automatically subscribe and unsubscribe people from forums in the course. We have some custom plugins at the OU which listen for course_added and course_deleted events, in order to clean up data belonging to the plugin that is linked to the course.
Comment 2: Hi tim, Thank you for the informations. It helps a lot to clear my doubts to proceed with moodle events. Thanks and regards, Dinesh.
Comment 3: Hi tim, Your comments are really useful. Based on the examples you pointed out, I tried to write an event handler function for assessable_file_uploaded . With given below function I am trying to send a email notification to all administrators. function assessable_file_uploaded_handler($eventdata) { global $DB; $user = $DB->get_record('user', array('id'=>$submission->userid), '*', MUST_EXIST); if ($admins = $this->get_admins()) { foreach ($admins as $admin) { $this->send_notification($user, $admin, 'gradersubmissionupdated', 'assign_notification', $submission->timemodified); } } } for more information this function is added to mod/assignment/locallib. Also I got a DB entry for this event handler. But yet to send the email notifications. i hope I need to use the parameter $eventdata. Can anyone point me out to use $eventdata to send the notification mails. Regards, Ramesh.
Comment 4: $eventdata is arbitrary data that is passed by the code that triggers the event.  I don't think that there is much documentation for the event data that is sent for each type of event, but you can find out easily enough by just searching the code for where the event is triggered (just search for the event name), and seeing what data is passed.
Comment 5: Hi Hubert, Thank you for the reply. I found the place from where the event is triggered. Its mod/assignment/type/ upload (single)/assignment.class.php $eventdata = new stdClass(); $eventdata->modulename   = 'assignment'; $eventdata->cmid         = $this->cm->id; $eventdata->itemid       = $submission->id; $eventdata->courseid     = $this->course->id; $eventdata->userid       = $USER->id; $eventdata->file         = $file; // This is depreceated - please use pathnamehashes instead! $eventdata->pathnamehashes = array($file->get_pathnamehash()); events_trigger('assessable_file_uploaded', $eventdata); I created an entry in mod/assign/db/events.php file as below. 'assignment_file_sent' => array ( 'handlerfile'      => 'mod/assign/locallib.php', 'handlerfunction'  => 'assessable_file_uploaded_handler',    // argument to call_user_func(), could be an array 'schedule'         => 'instant', 'internal'         => 1, ), Then I wrote the event handler function in mod/asssign.
