Post title: Request for comment on new plugin
Post description: Hello, I'm developing a new local/plugin that I called customclasses. The aim of this plugin is: - provide a mechanism to override through inheritance most of Moodle core classes (Eg. moodlepage,  any renderer, etc etc) - this mechanism should be theme independent - this mechanism should not conflict with standard moodle edition - but rather co-exist so that one could quickly switch on/off according to his needs - and obviously survive a moodle version upgrade In its basic form the plugin ships with only an empty derived custom_page class [CODE] class custom_page extends moodlepage{ //you decide what to override } [/CODE] and a customloader class to use this class to initialise the $PAGE instance and a plugin setting to switch on/off the plugin itself and a couple of lines to add in config.php While I know this is a rather controversial idea (and maybe already discarded by core developers), I think it still might interest someone and has some use cases. I set up a github repository ( https://github.com/mvit777/custom_moodle ) with a complete proof-of-concept implementation of the idea and extensive documentation. I thank in advance anyone who will to take the time to review/comment/criticize my work. M.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Tracker - too many commits
Post description: Hi all, I am having an issue with CiBot (our dear friend) on tracker... CiBot is not impressed I have two commits. But one commit is updating to the latest part of Moodle and the second is the bug fix... How do you fix this so CiBot is happy with just the bug change commit? Spent most the afternoon on this and I know it is going to be some low level git command but I have no idea and am starting to feel silly. https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-51827 Thanks all!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Josh, Check out the Moodle docs about rewriting commits . I like to use rebase and it's a good command to get to know if you are contributing to Moodle often. This accomplish what you were trying to do with the merge commit that CiBot is complaining about, which is to keep your branch up-to-date with the most recent changes upstream. It will also let you fix your commit message, which is the other thing CiBot was complaining about. Another way to make CiBot happy would be to create a new branch based on the most recent version of the upstream branch and cherry-pick your single commit onto it, though it would require you to update the ticket's branch fields.
Comment 2: Well, it now complaining that you have a merge commit. You should alwasy rebase (instead of merge) to get your changes on top of latest master before submitting them for integration.
Comment 3: I use rebase -i (interactive) https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Tools-Rewriting-History If you use the command 
```text
git rebase -i HEAD~2
```
 then you will see the instructions for squashing the last two commits into one.

Comment 1: Got clarity on some of the facts - a) db/events.php is not mandatory if we are defining event's class. b) We must have to follow the naming convention of the class file and class name - both the class name and class-file should be the same. c) Use namespace at the top event class if required (optional) d) There must be at least one underscore in the class name so that the word after the last underscore would be considered as action of trigger. That Code that I am using to trigger the event is [ // I have not used all the arguments of create method here $event = \local_programmanagement\event\prepayment_cycle_modified::create( array(' context '=>$context,   'other'=>array($data))); $event->trigger(); ] So, Points for taking into an account are 1) My class file should be  => local/programmanagement/classes/event/prepayment_cycle_added.php 2) My Class definition in the above file should be - [ namespace local_programmanagement\event; defined('MOODLE_INTERNAL') || die(); // class name is same as the class-flle name & also have at least one underscore in the name // so that the word after the last underscore would be considered as action of trigger automatically class prepayment_plancycle_added extends \core\event\base { protected function init() { $this->data['crud'] = 'c'; $this->data['edulevel'] = self::LEVEL_OTHER; } } ]

Post title: Moodle Rest API - Function Examples
Post description: Hello all, Does anyone know where I can find actual examples of web services calls to the API functions?  I found a working example of creating a user, which works great, but I can't find anywhere in the Moodle API documentation where it explains what parameters each function is expecting. Has anyone found any documentation like that? Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: https://docs.moodle.org/30/en/Using_web_services#Enabling_web_service_function_documentation
Comment 2: Darko, thanks for the reply, but I have the web service created.  I figured out what I was missing with the delete user function.  I just hadn't added that core function to my web service yet. Perhaps you could help with another related question.  I have successfully added a single user and deleted a single user, but what is the correct format to pass in an array of users to create or delete?
Comment 3: I have solved my own issue.  I just needed to add an ampersand between each of the values.  For example, to delete multiple users in one request: userids[0]=100&userids[1]=101 Hope this helps someone else.  I am building a C# class library for interacting with the Moodle Rest API.  When I am finished I will try to make it available via NuGet Package Manager.

Post title: This forum post has been removed
Post description: The content of this forum post has been removed and can no longer be accessed.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Dillon - I think you may have gotten off track somewhere. I recommend you look at an existing block with settings to see how they do it. Examples from core would be "course_list" or "course_overview". There is no reason that I can think of to move your block's settings into a separate file, since by definition, your block is a custom block. And "index.php" would be a bad choice anyway, since those usually have a specific purpose to be run as a standalone script. Hope this helps. mike
Comment 2: The content of this forum post has been removed and can no longer be accessed.
Comment 3: Looks like you might want to be using admin_externalpage to create a complete custom settings page. e.g. https://github.com/moodle/moodle/blob/master/report/configlog/settings.php which links to page: https://github.com/moodle/moodle/blob/master/report/configlog/index.php Once you have an external page, you need to call 'admin_externalpage_setup()' and then you can do whatever you want on that page (including defining + processing a custom form and then manually saving the results with 'set_config()').
Comment 4: The content of this forum post has been removed and can no longer be accessed.
Comment 5: The error message is pretty straightforward - it states that the parent settings element does not exist. Unless you have added it yourself, there is no element in the settings tree called 'blocks' - in admin/settings/plugins.php, there is an element created called 'blocksettings'  - I assume this is what you wanted to add your block configuration to?
Comment 6: The content of this forum post has been removed and can no longer be accessed.
Comment 7: On a settings page I use 
```text
$name = 'theme_flexibase/fontsep2';


$heading = get_string('fontsep2', 'theme_flexibase');


$information = get_string('fontsep2desc', 'theme_flexibase');


$setting = new admin_setting_heading($name, $heading, $information);


$temp->add($setting);
```
 to add a separator, but that separator is just a language string, so you could add almost anything in there - I have other examples where the language string includes images or information about a section of settings. So your language string becomes your 'label' content or your table. While it is generally not ideal to include significant html in a language file, in some instances (e.g. the chooseme section of a theme) it is almost unavoidable.

Forum Post: 
Post title: How to dinamically disable/enable custom activity and block
Post description: Hi, I've created custom Moodle plugin that integrates other custom made Moodle activities and blocks. Since it will not be used in all courses and by all users I need to support hiding/showing it dynamically. In Moodle plugin I implemented it is possible to list all Moodle Activities and blocks and to activate it in specific course. If, for example, Moodle activity is not activated for specific course, I need to disable that Moodle activity for the teacher, so he can't add it in his course. I know how to make already created activities invisible, but I don't know how to remove activity from "Add an activity or resource" menu in edit mode so teacher is prevented to use something that is not to be used in his course. For Moodle block, I need to hide/show it in the similar way like with activities, on the course level, without having teacher to manually add it. Teacher would just activate specific item in my custom Moodle plugin, and if there is block related to that item it should be activated without teacher having to search which block should be activated. On the other side, I also need to support same request on the user level, so if student decides to turn off/on support provided by my plugin, it should hide/show custom block(s) that are integrated with my plugin. Hope somebody have some idea how I can make this work Thanks, Zoran
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This is what the mod/zzz:addinstance capability is for. Edit the definition of the editing Teacher role to remove that capability. (And any other roles for which this is relevant.) Then, in courses where you want the activity to be available, go to Course administration -> Permissions, and add that capability back.
Comment 2: Hi Tim, That's exactly what I needed. I'm using assign_capability() and unassign_capability() to control it dynamically. Thanks a lot,

Forum Post: 
Post title: Architecture, Array vs SQL
Post description: Hi, im currently working on a Block Plugin that loads some data via the Competency-, Course Module- and Gradebook- API into arrays, calculates some stuff and writes it into the block content. Changes are only necessary if a student gets a new grade or something in the course structure changes. Since I want to build it with best practise and good performance architecture Im thinking about the following points: - I tried to do everything with API calls, parsing the needed data out of them. I could also put everything together in one self made SQL Query with some Joins. Which option is the better one? - Should I hold all the data in arrays or create and insert a new DB table? I guess arrays would have the better performance but the database solution maybe prettier and easier to maintain? - At the moment Im executing everything in the get_content() function in the main file, so everything is loaded all the time with every site refresh, which is not optimal regarding performance and modularity I guess. How can I design that better? - With a database solution I would calculate everything and store it in a table. Then I would have to listen to events and everytime an activity gets graded or something in the course changes, like a new activity gets created, I would have to update the table in the database. Does that make sense? I hope somebody can give me some advice regarding these issues! Also a link to an example plugin covering some of this things would help a lot! Thank you!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: - I tried to do everything with API calls, parsing the needed data out of them. I could also put everything together in one self made SQL Query with some Joins. Which option is the better one? This is a bit of a toss-up between raw performance and maintainability.  Sticking everything into a big SQL query will probably be more performant (as long as you write the SQL well), but it will probably be less obvious what's going on when you or someone else comes back to this code at a later date. Also, API functions will take care of any underlying changes to the database structure, which you'd otherwise have to watch out for. - Should I hold all the data in arrays or create and insert a new DB table? I guess arrays would have the better performance but the database solution maybe prettier and easier to maintain? - At the moment Im executing everything in the get_content() function in the main file, so everything is loaded all the time with every site refresh, which is not optimal regarding performance and modularity I guess. How can I design that better? - With a database solution I would calculate everything and store it in a table. Then I would have to listen to events and everytime an activity gets graded or something in the course changes, like a new activity gets created, I would have to update the table in the database. Does that make sense? Have you looked at caching ?  It sounds like that would be better suited to this case than storing the display data in the database.  You can just stick the display data in the cache, then check if it's there before doing new queries/API calls.  You can also define events which will automatically invalidate data in the cache.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle Migration resources errors and not loading
Post description: Hi I've moved a Moodle installation for one server to another.  After moving the original site I upgraded the site to a new version (2.2 -> 2.6) The site in general appears to be working howerver course resources are not. There are several Word documents that can be downloaded and these are downloading with 0 size and display a error when attempting to open. When attempting to open a SCORM resource created in Articulate a new window opens as expected but it is empty.  Right clicking the window shows it is Flash that is trying to run.  There are no errors displayed. Note i'm not getting any PHP errors such as file not found so I assume the path is OK and no permission errors I've tried backing up the original course and then restoring it but this didn't work. If I upload a new word file then that works. Has anyone come across this problem before? Andy
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Have you run the database migration script refered to in the docs? That changes any references that may be in the database (e.g. hard coded url links) to make sure they point at the correct location on the new server. https://docs.moodle.org/en/Moodle_migration
Comment 2: Hi Richard Thanks for the response.  I updated the database url before importing into it.  I did run the replace script as well but it made no difference. I'm wondering if the base64 files that the resources are stored as are getting corrupted somehow or can't be read correctly.  Possibly some server configuration issue. Apache or php issue. I'm going to try the migration process again and see if the issue is there before i do any updates. Andy
Comment 3: Well, I finally got the files to download and the Flash resources to display and run. The problem was to do with the size of the Moodledata folder.  It was far to big to FTP the content without corrupting the files for this particular server.  I tried using the hosts control panel tools to zip / tar /tar.gz the files but this failed. Finally I contacted the host and they created a tar file for me.  I them FTP'd this directly to the new server using Linux command line ftp.  This way I could also see that the filesize on the original server and the one that arrived were the same size, which is a good sign. I then unzipped the tar, moved the folder it to the correct place in the file system, renamed it (moodledata) and reset the permissions. It worked!! A lesson here is, if the Moodledata folder is very large just ask the host to zip it as a tar then transfer directly to the new host.  Don't download to a local machine then upload again.  The transfers increase the risk of corrupting the data.
Comment 4: This was exactly my problem. Thank you Andrew. People cannot rule out data corruption when compressing or ftp transferring the 'moodledata' folder. At first I used 'tar.gz' to compress the folder and used Filezilla for the transfer to the new server and none of the images would show on the site including the logo (after I did all the necessary URL changes in  the DB, as the domain name changed). I then used zip to compress and transfer and it worked! I'm not sure if 'tar' compression would have prevented this too, or if it was in the FTP transfer where the corruption happened. Bottom line is, retry the process using different compression method perhaps and then transfer (ftp) again. This could save you time instead of trying to looking in all the config settings etc.
Comment 5: Hi Andy, When you say that you migrated the site, did you migrate the Moodle data directory as well as the directory with the Moodle code in it?  It sounds to me as though your Moodle data folder is either missing or
incomplete - if the new server is configured to use a path that Apache can write to, it
will have created a new empty folder structure on the new server in the
absence of the original one - so it won't give you any PHP errors, but no files (resources, SCORM activities , or anything else stored in the data directory) will work. If you're not sure where the data directory is, check the value of $CFG-> dataroot in config.php - and make sure that the new server has $CFG->dataroot set to the appropriate location (containing the copy of all the files from your old server). If this is what's happened, since you've already run the upgrade to 2.6, you won't want to transfer the cache and various other temporary directories - the most important bit to transfer now is the "filedir" folder within the data directory, and if you have any filesystem repositories configured, the "repository" folder too.  If there's a "lang" folder, you might also want to take that - any local customisations to the language pack(s) are stored in that folder, but you should check those to make sure that they still apply, as strings do sometimes change between Moodle versions.  Everything other than those three folders (filedir, repository, lang) should have been rebuilt (where appropriate) by Moodle already - and will be appropriate for 2.6 (whereas the ones on the old server will still be Moodle 2.2 files, which could potentially cause some strange issues). Edited to add: If you did copy the data directory over and it's in the location configured in config.php, double-check the file permissions - if your webserver can't read the existing files, it can't serve them (but newly uploaded files will be created by the webserver, and thus it will have access to them). Hope that helps.
Comment 6: Hi Paul Thanks for the reply. The process I followed was as follows: Moved the original site to my local machine.  This included Moodle file, Moodle data files and database. Replaced the original URLs in the SQL dump to the one for my local machine and imported into a local database and then made the changes to the config file for my local machine. Tested the site worked and made a backup of it. I then upgraded the site to the next version of Moodle, moved any missing module back into the file system and tested it.  All seemed good. I then repeated the process of backing up the latest version including files, moodledata and database then upgrading and checking for new module updates. Once it was updated to the version I wanted and it was working locally I migrated the whole site to the live server, changing the URLs in the database to the live site URL and making the relevant changes to the config files. Once running on the live site some images are missing, docx files don't download correctly and articulate flash does not play. The file and folder permissions for moodledata appear to be fine. I'm wondering if its a wider server issue.  An apache setting or missing php module. Andy
Comment 7: See de slash arguments configuration. should be activated Diego From BsAs

Forum Post: 
Post title: Get rid of fullname override parameter
Post description: I recently created this tracker issue: MDL-46653 - Get rid of fullname override parameter The problem is that with the introduction of the Additional name fields in Moodle 2.6 ( MDL-31776 - Additional name fields), we tried setting the setting $CFG->fullnamedisplay to take advantage of this new feature. However, there are several places in Moodle in which the fullname() function is passed with the $override parameter and our $CFG->fullnamedisplay setting is ignored. My question is the $override flag needed and does it still make sense with the "Additional name fields" feature? In the ticket I list the places in which the override flag is set and it is annoying to have a config setting not respected across the system without a good reason. Please reply if you can give some good use cases for keeping the override flag that I am not thinking of or vote for the feature if you are also annoyed by this implementation.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: just a bit of information regarding the history of the override parameter for people that don't know. It is normally marked true when the user has the capability moodle/site:viewfullnames. Sometimes it is desirable on some sites to limit what names the students can see, but still allow teachers to see the full names of everyone. Since the introduction of the additional name fields and the alteration of the fullnamedisplay setting, we are now in the strange situation that if all of the fields are configured in the fullnamedisplay setting that people with the moodle/site:viewfullnames capability are actually shown less information. I think that we could still make use of the moodle/site:viewfullnames capability and so I have been working on MDL-40356 which adds an additional setting for configuring how names are displayed with this capability. Perhaps people could comment here if they think that a new parameter is a good idea or not.
Comment 2: +1 sounds like the best solution.

Post description: I am running Moodle 2.6.3 . Actually I have been working with it, and the theme Genesis, and it was working all fine. Then due to some reasons, I had to reinstall Moodle. Now when I install the theme Genesis, I get this error on the homepage : Fatal error : Call to undefined method core_renderer_maintenance::loadGoogleFont() in C:\xampp\htdocs\moodle\theme\genesis\layout\general.php on line 66 The rest of the pages display correctly. I guess it does load Google fonts on every page, but I am getting the error on the homepage only. Has anyone encountered this? Any advice for me?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You probably need to contact the developer of Genesis directly as, from memory, this is a commercial paid for theme which we are unable to supprot in the community as we do not have access to it.
Comment 2: Actually it was working perfectly fine previously, so I anticipate there is something malfunctioning in Moodle. :S
Comment 3: loadGoogleFonts() is a member of core_renderer_maintenance (according to the error) and the error says it is undefined. So I think the problem must be in core_renderer_maintenance, not the theme.
Comment 4: Hello Zarah, Of course core_renderer_maintenance class is part of core Moodle but themes can extend this class (by saying something like class theme_genesis_core_renderer_maintenance extends core_renderer_maintenance) so the error message don't means that the problem is not in the Genesis theme. Follow the advice to contact the Genesis theme developer. Maybe this theme is dependent in another plugin being installed ?
Comment 5: Oh yes you are right. Thank you. The had mysteriously gone away on a reinstall of Moodle. If that did not work, talking to the theme developers was what I would have to do,

Forum Post: 
Post title: Is there any code checker for JavaScript plugins?
Post description: Hi all, Reading the development documentation, I've found the Moodle Code Checker GitHub repo , for PHP code. But the JavaScript coding guidelines page doesn't mention any code checker for JavaScript plugins. I've tried the one I mentioned above, just in case, with JavaScript code that doesn't respect the standard, but it doesn't throw any alert nor warning, so I suppose the is nothing defined. Is there code checker defined for the JavaScript standards? Best regards, Julen
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: There is JavaScript checking on Travis CI, if you have a public plugin repository on GitHub. Whenever you push an update to GitHub, Travis kicks in and automatically checks both the PHP and JavaScript code. It works a treat for me - the results are shown online on the corresponding Travis website, e.g. https://travis-ci.org/ecampbell/moodle-atto_wordimport/jobs/92241555 for my particular plugin. Instructions on how to configure this are at https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=323384 The main downside is that you must first publish your changes to Github in order for the checks to run, so you then have to update the files again to fix the problems. Another issue is that the versions of the code-checking programs that run on the local Moodle CodeChecker are older than the versions on the Travis CI site, so you may get different results. For example, the directive "@codingStandardsIgnoreLine" generates a warning locally, but is accepted by Travis CI.

Forum Post: Post title: Disabling buttons on TinyMCE Editor Post description: Dear Fellow Moodlers, I am new to Moodle Development and I am current working on a use case where I need to enable "Media Button" for courses belonging to one root category and make sure that only course administrator can see the "Media Button". I think I have partially achieved the result by editing the moodle/lib/editor/tinymce/plugins/moodlemedia/lib.php but may be this is not the right way to achieve this. Since I am new to Moodle Development I don't know the best practices, so I would appreciate if anyone could advise me on this. //Course Category for which the Media Button should be enabled define('PERMITTED_COURSE_CATEGORY_ID',2); class tinymce_moodlemedia extends editor_tinymce_plugin { /** @var array list of buttons defined by this plugin */ protected $buttons = array('moodlemedia'); protected function update_init_params(array &$params, context $context, array $options = null) { global $DB,$PAGE,$COURSE,$USER; //Current Course Category $course_category = $COURSE->category; //List of Valid Role IDs (1 - Manager, 3 - editingTeacher) $valid_role_ids = array(1,3); //Get User Role $context = get_context_instance(CONTEXT_COURSE, $COURSE->id, true); $roles = get_user_roles($context, $USER->id, true); $role = key($roles); $roleid = (int)$roles[$role]->roleid; /* * Used this snippet but gives me the following error "Coding error detected, it must be fixed by a programmer: Legacy capabilities can not be used any more!" $context = get_context_instance(CONTEXT_COURSE,$COURSE->id); if (has_capability('moodle/legacy:student', $context, $USER->id, false) ) { echo "is Student
"; } if (has_capability('moodle/legacy:teacher', $context, $USER->id, false) ) { echo "is Assitent Teacher
"; } if (has_capability('moodle/legacy:editingteacher', $context, $USER->id, false)) { echo "is Teacher
"; } if (has_capability('moodle/legacy:admin', $context, $USER->id, false)) { echo "is ADMIN
"; } */ // Add file picker callback. //Checking whether the current course belongs to Course Category and check user has got the appropriate roles if(PERMITTED_COURSE_CATEGORY_ID == $course_category && in_array($roleid,$valid_role_ids)) { if (empty($options['legacy'])) { if (isset($options['maxfiles']) and $options['maxfiles'] != 0) { $params['file_browser_callback'] = "M.editor_tinymce.filepicker"; } } if ($row = $this->find_button($params, 'moodleemoticon')) { // Add button after 'moodleemoticon' icon. $this->add_button_after($params, $row, 'moodlemedia', 'moodleemoticon'); } else if ($row = $this->find_button($params, 'image')) { // Note: We know that the plugin emoticon button has already been added // if it is enabled because this plugin has higher sortorder. // Otherwise add after 'image'. $this->add_button_after($params, $row, 'moodlemedia', 'image'); } else { // Add this button in the end of the first row (by default 'image' button should be in the first row). $this->add_button_after($params, 1, 'moodlemedia'); } // Add JS file, which uses default name. $this->add_js_plugin($params); } } protected function get_sort_order() { return 110; } } Kind Regards, Joe Comments associated with the post: Comment 1: Firstly, it's a bad idea to change core Moodle files, as it causes a lot of conflicts during upgrades. Far better to create a new TinyMCE plugin to handle this. The best way to achieve this is a plugin that defines a new capability that can be used to determine who can see the button (it should go in lib/editor/tinymce/plugins/MYPLUGINNAME/db/access.php - look at other examples to see the format). You should then create a lib.php file in the MYPLUGINNAME directory, with an 'update_init_params' function. The update_init_params function has a 'context' already, so you don't need to use the old get_context_instance functions (if you needed, you could call context_course::instance($courseid), but you don't need to in this case). Firstly do a 'has_capability('name of the new capability you created', $context)' to check if the user is able to add see the buttons at all. Next, as a site admin, you can override the role definitions at the level of the category, so that only 'course creators' (or is it 'editing teachers') within that specific category (and sub categories and courses) have that capability. Once you've established the capability, you can then look through the contents of the '$params' variable to remove the 'moodlemedia' button, if it is found in any of the 'theme_advanced_buttonsXX' parts (unless they do have the required capability). If you makes sure your plugin returns 9999 from 'get_sort_order', then it will run after the moodlemedia plugin, so it can remove the button from the settings, after it has been initialised. Feel free to ask for more explanation if that isn't enough help. Comment 2: Hi there, I am totally new to Moodle but have a similar situation. After searching the net, I have found your advice, but I am not sure I fully understand. As you suggested, I have created my own Plug-in Folder with a db/access.php file and a lib.php file. Is the access.php file supposed to be like a Configuration file or what is it supposed to do? You then write the following: "Firstly do a 'has_capability('name of the new capability you created', $context)' to check if the user is able to add see the buttons at all. Next, as a site admin, you can override the role definitions at the level of the category, so that only 'course creators' (or is it 'editing teachers') within that specific category (and sub categories and courses) have that capability. Once you've established the capability, you can then look through the contents of the '$params' variable to remove the 'moodlemedia' button, if it is found in any of the 'theme_advanced_buttonsXX' parts (unless they do have the required capability)." Could you explain this a little bit more? I really appreciate any help, as I said, I have never come across Moodle before and it is still rather confusing. Thank you very much in advance. Label:

Post title: Normal number of queries in a single request
Post description: Hi, I have installed dynatrace on our servers, I saw that on the course/view.php page there are sometimes 1500 queries, is it something normal? Raphael
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Wow... that is interesting. Is that from one access? What is the action to generate that kind of response? How does that affect responses? Is it returning the same query response or just a few bytes at a time? There are a lot of other questions here... My interest here is purely speculative, I do not know enough of how the data extraction layer works to make any kind of positive response to your question. And I am interested in how this affects overall Moodle performance....
Comment 2: What is on the course page that is generating that many queries? What is the number produced by a blank new course?
Comment 3: Are you able to reproduce this consistently, or is it intermittent? If it is consistent, then maybe xhprof can tell you what is triggering all those db queries. https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Profiling_PHP
Comment 4: Also, is it vanilla clean Moodle distribution or are there some additional plugins involved?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Wrong character encoding as "combined diacritics" instead of the proper "precomposed characters"
Post description: Background: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Combining_character https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Precomposed_character Preface: this is a issue in dnduploadlib.php in the course directory and unknown other places. I tried to file an issue in the moodle issue tracker, but as a not that tech savvy person, the obstacles to actually file an issue drove me nuts – so I put the issue here, maybe someone catches it up. *** When uploading a file via dnduploadlib.php, characters with diacritics like german ä, ö, ü in the filename are encoded as so called "composed characters / combining characters": an <ä> is composed out of an <a> combined with an <¨>. In combination with some operatimg systems, browsers and webfonts (OSX, Firefox and Open Sans, for example) these combined characters are faultly interpreted as two separate symbols: <a¨>, which leads to a problem when using things like auto-linking: When I upload a file called "Mäuse.pdf" for example, and autolinking for files is on, then typing the string "Mäuse.pdf" with the keyboard doesn't lead to an autolinked entry because the character "ä" in the filename is encoded as (hex)61CC88, whilst when using the keyboard the character "ä" is encoded as (hex)C3A4. dnduploadlib.php has to be aware of these combined diacritics ((hex)61CC88 for example) and should convert them to the proper precomposed characters ((hex)C3A4 for example). For my special needs, I hacked dnduploadlib.php and replaced the german umlauts. Since I am a frontend developer, that's all I can contribute to this issue, would be great, if a more tech savvy person could find a more radical and generic solution – I've found out, that the same problem occurs on a forum, even when dnduploadlib.php is patched; but I couldn't figure out, what code part is responsible for that.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Installed block not showing in 'Add block'
Post description: Here's a general question with a very specific context , related to a custom-developed block. First the question: Why might a correctly-installed block not appear in the Add a Block dropdown in edit mode? Now the context: I've created a block - call it Hamster Herding - for local use. I've developed and tested it on localhost using Moodle 2.6 and XAMPP, then deployed it on a live test system. It used to work fine on local and remote hosts. We then decided that it needed to be renamed. I went through all the renaming procedures (files, variables, caches, etc), then put the block in moodle/blocks/hamster_herding and installed it via Admin >> Notifications. The block appeared to install ok, and when I then went into Site Admin >> Plugins >> Blocks >> Manage Block s I could see it listed there. However, it didn't appear in the Add a Block dropdown so of course I couldn't add it to a course. Neither do any error messages appear. Amongst many other measures, I've: de- and re-installed the block flushed Moodle caches flushed browser caches from the beginning of time set developer errors to super-picky installed the block on another machine altogether changed the block version number read TFM and TFFAQ I think it's almost certainly related to the use of caches in the block, which are needed because of the institutional context in which it'll be deployed. I have just used basic cacheing code as specified in the Cache API , and when renaming the block made sure to rename the block caches. I'm sure that it'll be one tiny tweak somewhere that's needed, but I just can't find the cause of the problem as I'm getting no feedback from Moodle at all, so a pointer or two would be appreciated. Still fumbling in the undergrowth... Fred
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Have you tried fiddling with the applicable_formats settings? The big fiddle would be to set all to true. Don't do it in production though. Like this. public function applicable_formats() { return array('all' => true); }
Comment 2: Not sure if this helps but MOODLE was not recognising one of my blocks which had a camel case naming conventaion.  I swapped it to unserscores and all lower case and it then recognised it.

Post title: Calling a linux shell script from the module code
Post description: Hello fellow developers. I am verry sorry for bothering you with such a newbie question, but I'm just so confused by the structure of moodle code. What I'm trying to do is improving the existing moodle activity module "onlinejudge". For those unfamiliar: Online judge is used to create a programming assignments and predefined testcases that are used to assess student's submissions. I have a shell script that creates a text file containing the assignment and another text file, which contains a number of test cases. There's a form that creates the Online Judge assignment. I need to create a listbox, from which a teacher can choose an existing assignment template(a text file on a hard drive) and a button that will call a shell script, that will process this template file. SHell script will produce two files: assignment and a number of testcases. I need to record the contents of those files to moodle DB. Is it even possible?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Yes, you can run shell scripts by using the 'exec' PHP command. This is potentially a very dangerous command to call, as any bug in your code could allow someone to run any command they want on your server , so make sure you are very careful with it.
Comment 2: You might be interested in this plugin: https://github.com/trampgeek/CodeRunner
Comment 3: Thank you for your answers. It's really great that the shell scripts can be run. The next step is to automatically create assignments, using the text files created by the script. Can I do that? Can moodle access those text files, stored in some pre-defined location? It goes like this: I run the script from the php-code of the module, the module reads the files created by the script and writes some values from those files to the DB. Can it be done? Thank you, you are such a supportive community!

Forum Post: 
Post title: mdl_context - Null path for course context
Post description: Hi all We're working with an Identity Management provider who are helping us to automatically provision students and courses from our student management system. We're hoping that their solution will create a whole batch of new courses for us (and then enrol students onto them). Basically they are creating drivers that will insert values into the mdl_course table to create a new course. They will then construct a mysql trigger that will insert a row into the mdl_context table (with values for contextlevel = 50 and the instanceid of the course just created). This trigger will fire on an INSERT event into the mdl_course table. We've tried a few tests and the resultant mdl_context entry for that course has a PATH field of NULL.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: 1. Yes, this will definitely cause a problem if the path field is NULL. 2. You probably don't want to use a trigger. If you ever create a course from within Moodle, you will end up with two records in mdl_context, which will most likely confuse something in Moodle. 3. You should avoid manipulating the Moodle database directly. You may want to look into using the external database enrolment plugin instead.
Comment 2: Many thanks for your time Hubert. Thats pretty much what I thought too - thanks for confirming! Dickie
Comment 3: Hi Hubert. Could you explain me in detail. I am facing same error moodle version 3.0.3 after upgrade. When am create a  course in moodle. The mdl_context table PATH field create with NULL and depth is 0. I am not understand why this happen.

Forum Post: 
Post title: get_records_sql returns unique records
Post description: I am trying to execute the below query in Moodle and it displays unique records where as the same query displays multiple records in phpMyAdmin - database ?  How can I execute in Moodle to returns multiple records like phpMyAdmin database? $get_assignment_pending_course = $DB->get_records_ sql ('SELECT u.id AS user_id,u.firstname,u.lastname,ma.name AS assignment_name,mc.fullname AS course_name,mc.id AS course_id,ma.duedate AS assignment_duedate,mcm.id as assignment_id FROM TBL_course mc JOIN TBL_course_categories mcc on mcc.id = mc.category JOIN TBL_course_modules mcm on mc.id = mcm.course AND mcm.module = 1 JOIN TBL_modules mm on mm.id = mcm.module JOIN TBL_enrol e on e.courseid = mc.id JOIN TBL_user_enrolments ue on ue.enrolid = e.id JOIN TBL_user u on u.id = ue.userid JOIN TBL_assign ma on mcm.instance = ma.id WHERE mcm.id IN(559,1286,1298,1306,1310,1314)');
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: As described in the docs ( https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Data_manipulation_API ), the get_records_* functions return an array of results indexed by the first field in the results. So, in your case the array is indexed by the user.id field, meaning that there will only be one record per user in the results. If this is not what you wanted, the either choose a different field to be first in the SELECT part of your query or use the get_recordset_sql function instead and loop through the results using foreach. Note also that you should write {user} for database table names, not TBL_user, as that way Moodle will automatically insert the configured prefix for your system.
Comment 2: I used rand() function and fixed it.
Comment 3: Note that, when doing development, you should have Debugging set to Developer level. If you do, then you get all sorts of helpful warnings about possible problems in your code, including this easy-to-make mistake.

Post title: How to stop re-uploading of files on reload ?
Post description: Following is the process I am doing on CSV File Upload . $cir = new csv_import_reader($iid, 'uploaduser'); 1) Open $cir->init(); 2) Process 3) Close  $cir->close(); 4) Cleanup $cir->cleanup(); 5) View the Result Once the result is being displayed,if  I accidentally reload the page,the file is getting processed again,which shouldn't happen.It should remove the file on cleanup isnt't it ? How do i don the proper cleanup to avoid re-processing of previously uploaded file on page reload ?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: One of the ways Moodle avoids this is by doing something like: 1) Open $cir->init(); 2) Process 3) Close  $cir->close(); 4) Cleanup $cir->cleanup(); 5) Automatically redirect the user to the results page. Then refreshing the page will not cause any data to be resubmitted.

Post title: Convenience tables
Post description: Thinking about an enhancement I would like to see, I have started to look at the Moodle codebase, from a position of having never written PHP.  One of the things I have noticed is that there are quite a few integer fields in tabes that can only be meaningfully interpreted by referring back to the code; for example, course_completion_criteria. It may simply be that I'm looking in the wrong place, but I could not see any table that mapped the integer to a string; that only occurs, AFAICT, in completion_criteria.php. If this is so, has the possibility of providing convenience tables been mooted?  Such tables would be auto-generated from the code, and would only be referred to in ad hoc queries, so they would have no impact on the performance of the system, but would be a great boon to those, like me, who are trying to get a handle on what's happening in the database . It occurs to me that this would be an easy and no-risk way of getting my feet wet with the codebase. Am I on the right track?

Post title: Getting student count
Post description: Hi friends, I have developed a plugin in such a way that a teacher can take some 'Assessment test' with students under him in real time. I need to get the number of students active on that particular session under the teacher. So that the number of students should be shown on teacher. Just like active users listed in social media or hangouts(Names not compulsory count also will do ). Please help me friends!!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: you have to use this sql query 
```text
SELECT COUNT(*)

FROM mdl_course AS course 
JOIN mdl_enrol AS en ON en.courseid = course.id
JOIN mdl_user_enrolments AS ue ON ue.enrolid = en.id
JOIN mdl_user AS user2 ON ue.userid = user2.id
```
Comment 2: It will returns you total count I need the number of users currently logged in and attending that particular session.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Questions about Moodle GPL licence
Post description: Any idea or clarification about my following questions? I would be thankful for cthis I am
creating a website application using Moodle software, the website will
be teaching language, and nothing to do with information technology. I
need clarity on what you mean by "*Modified Version *" Why should my language students be
interested in the source code of the platform. Also
what do you mean by *'program's users'* - does this refer to students? who
access my application to learn language, or other software programmers who
may want to create a similar application - am I obliged by the GPL to give
them my modified source code? Also
with respect to this GPL, what is the definition of "modified
program"? Please
refer to the below FAQ from your website https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-faq.en.html#GPLRequireSourcePostedPublic Q: Does
the GPL require that source code of modified versions be posted to the public? (#GPLRequireSourcePostedPublic https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-faq.en.html#GPLRequireSourcePostedPublic >) Q: Does the GPL require that source code of modified versions be posted to the public if we use moodle as part of our project? (Please see para below from GPL) The
GPL does not require you to release your modified version, or any part of
it. You are free to make modifications and use them privately, without ever
releasing them. This applies to organizations (including companies), too;
an organization can make a modified version and use it internally without
ever releasing it outside the organization. But
*if* you release the modified version to the public in some way, the GPL
requires you to make the modified source code available to the program's users,
under the GPL. Thus,
the GPL gives permission to release the modified program in certain ways,
and not in other ways; but the decision of whether to release it is up
to you. Q2: Does it mean that if my organization uses Moodle in the business, we can not release this project to the public rather we can only use internally ? If it is so, how can we execute our project using Moodle? We are to sell courses to the public. ------------------------------------------ Sorry for misconceptions if have, clarification will be highly appreciated: Regards Salman
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This has come up several times in the Moodle forums. My understanding of the situation (and I am not a lawyer, but this seems to fit with most people's understanding of the GPL) is that running software on a server and using it to generate the web pages that users access is NOT counted as distributing the software. This means that you can run modified versions of the Moodle code on your server and there is no requirement for you to provide the source code to anyone. If you do provide the source code to someone, however, they are fully within their rights to modify it further and use it how they want. There is a separate licence called AGPL, which Moodle does NOT use, which does require you to provide the source code for websites running that code (which again, strengthens the case that GPL itself does not require you to share the source code for websites - as, if it did, there would be no reason for AGPL to exist).
Comment 2: Why should my language students be
interested in the source code of the platform. The idea behind the GPL is that your language students are not just language students, they're people who may be interested in how the software they are using works, and so they should be allowed to view and modify the source code if they wish. However, David's quite right in that hosting a site based on Moodle code does not oblige you to distribute the source code under the GPL, since this is not considered "releasing" your software under the terms of this license.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Development of an announcements plugin
Post description: Dear All,

I am working on developing an announcements module for Moodle like the one BlackBoard has (basically, when you login you get a pop-up with the text of the announcements for all modules you are registered on).

I had a look at the documentation for developing plug-ins, and I think I need a resource plug-in (so that each course can have a form for creating the announcement) and, probably, some modification in the page rendering files for adding the code before the other contents of the page start loading.

Could someone let me know if I am on the right track - do I need to look at any other type of plugin?

Regards,
George
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You need to be a bit more specific. What constitues an announcement? There is also terminology issue. I assume bb module would be a course ( or not ).
Comment 2: Let us assume following: Every moodle course should be able to provide it's own announcements. Announcement would be a text message defined by course administrator/teacher. Whenever user log's in a popup window will appear listing all available announcements from courses in which user is enrolled. If above assumptions are correct than most reasonable approach would be to implement this as a block. You would place a block in every course that is to provide announcements and on the site front page . Instance of block in course would offer interface for admins to manage announcements. Instance of block on the front page would provide handling for displaying popup.
Comment 3: Dear Darko, Many thanks for your prompt reply; your assumptions are all correct. The ideal behavior for me would be that: i) for every course the link to Add an Activity or a Resource would give the option to the user to add a new announcement (maybe later with advanced features, e.g. the announcement is available between this date and that date and so on); ii) when the user logs in a pop-up window opens up with all the announcements attached to the modules the user is enrolled in and are valid. Now i) would point towards a module plugin but ii) maybe refers to minor edits in the theme code? Can anyone throw some light into this? Regards, George
Comment 4: Afaik there is no such plugin. The only way to accomplish that exact behavior is to modify core. The only reasonable approach is the custom block that needs to be developed.
Comment 5: Hi Darko, Sure; if I understood you correctly when the user logs in he will get a block containing all announcements. There are a couple of things I am not clear with this approach: i) A block will have a very limited amount of space presence and usually announcements would be a few sentences long; and ii) A user should be able to create announcements for different modules so would something at a course level not be required? (I am aware that the News Forum can solve some of the issues, but I would like to still investigate the possibility of going for the announcements functionality). How would you comment on my other approach - have a form at the course level so that announcements can be created and add some code in the theme when the page loads up along the lines of: check if $USER is set and if yes fetch all announcements for them and pop up a window populated with these announcements? Regards, George
Comment 6: I'd add MyHome/ Dashboard as well as the front page for the pop-up version of the block to Darko's suggestion. Personally though i'm not sure about the form+theme approach - I would say it either has to be entirely separate from the theme, or it has to be entirely within the theme. If you get to the situation of block+theme then you are making it much harder for anyone to integrate your plugin as they would not necessarily want to make use of the theme provided and would then have to add the customisations to their own theme manually. The problem with doing it from within the theme entirely is that the theme settings are an admin area rather than a teacher area. One thing to look at may be the existing MyCourses/MyHome page where it already looks at forum/noticeboard posts and tells users if they have any unread messages. Possibly what you could look at is a block that extends that, pulling them all into one area for display - still uses the News and Notices to create the announcements (familiar for staff posting the notices) but displays as a pop-up over the frontpage/myHome page.

Forum Post: 
Post title: About Moodle vulnerability of SHA1
Post description: Hello everyone, We are currently using Moodle with 2.7 and our security vendor said the SHA1 will be retired soon, and it seems Moodle is using SHA1/MD5 for encryption They have below vulnerability comments: Vulnerability :  Use of Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm Impact :  The use of a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm is an unnecessary risk that may result in the disclosure of sensitive information. Recommendation :  Use SHA-2 instead of SHA-1 Sorry, I am new to this forum and I tried to search around Moodle docs and it seems there is no information about this.  Would someone please provide more information if Moodle is safeguard of SHA1 issue? What I got is something related is the Moodle's Password salting ( https://docs.moodle.org/23/en/Password_salting ) Many thanks, Tanky
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: If you upgrade Moodle, it will no longer use SHA1 for passwords. (Not sure when it changed, but it was quite a long time ago.)
Comment 2: Further to what Tim said, the documentation on password salting you linked to is for Moodle 2.3, which is out of date (this is also indicated on the page itself). The latest version, which applies to Moodle 2.5 onwards, is here: https://docs.moodle.org/30/en/Password_salting
Comment 3: Thanks, Tim, I may not aware I quote the wrong version of Docs, but the scanning was done exactly our existing Moodle (v2.7) which means they detect Moodle using SHA1 in our system.  Since we change a lot coding in our Moodle version, so it is impossible to directly upgrade to current version (3.0). So I am still not quite sure Moodle 2.7 has any safeguard for SHA1 (either stop using or alternative protection), anyone help? please. Thanks, Tanky
Comment 4: I'm not an expert on this, but I suggest you double-check with your vendor about exactly where the SHA1 function is used within Moodle. It is not, as far as I am aware, used on passwords: the PHP password_hash function is used instead. It is however, used extensively to provide a unique hash of file content, in order to calculate a storage location for those files. This is not (in any way that I can figure out) a security-sensitive use of SHA1. I would be interested to be corrected on any of this though ...
Comment 5: Dear Davo, Thanks. The vendor is doing Source code scanning, and report there are SHA1/MD5 using in Moodle. e,g, below PHP pages. (little partial) /admin/user.php /admin/userawardpointrule.php /calendar/export.php /calendar/export_execute.php /course/delete.php We check those files are not being modified by us, so we are not sure how we can deal with it. p.s. Our SSL cert has been deployed in SHA256 format. Thanks, Tanky
Comment 6: Well, to take the first example, the md5 hash in /admin/user.php is not used for security purposes, but simply to add an extra layer of protection to prevent accidentally deleting the wrong user (it means the admin user cannot simply change the userid in the URL to delete a different user). This use of a hash is not designed to prevent a deliberate attack (there are other mechanisms in place to prevent that), but the accidental misuse of a feature, so discussions about how secure or otherwise md5 is in that case are totally irrelevant. You do not need to change that file, because it has no security implications at all. If you want someone to go through each and every one of those uses for you, then you are going to need to employ a developer with a good understanding of how Moodle works to check them all. However, I am pretty confident that you will find that none of these 'insecure' hash functions is used in a place whereby they are actually being used as a security measure. The places that matter (password hashing) are already following best practice in terms of secure hashing.
Comment 7: Simply scanning source code for keywords is very little help in assessing the security of a system*, security is a much more complex and subtle business than that. As I mentioned, even given a weak hash that is used on passwords and direct access to the data it is difficult to get passwords out of a system. And by the time you have that access you probably don't need or want the passwords. *however it is probably very useful for spreading worry and selling consultancy.
Comment 8: Thanks Marcus, I understand you point.  As the security scanning is required by our organisation, the report show it is a security hole which doesn't mean Moodle is broken.  We strong believe Moodle has enough protection as the large community and user-base worldwide. I just can't find such information so I would ask anyone who know it would help. I also understand the risk level may not be high, but as a developer, we have to take the report into account in order to provide safe environment as well as System to end user. Thanks for your reply.  I think if anyone could tell me which version of Moodle stopped using SHA1 is appreciated.
Comment 9: There is no Moodle documentation about which uses of SHA1 / md5 in Moodle are security risks for one very simple reason: If there are known security risks in the Moodle code, then they are fixed, before they are announced. If there are unknown security risks in Moodle, then they are not documented, because, obviously, they have to be known in order to be documented. If you believe you have found a specific security risk in Moodle, then please check it carefully and then report it to http://tracker.moodle.org (but not just a list of all instances of SHA1/md5 in the source code, as that is not helpful to anyone). If you would like someone to go through each of the reported instances and do a complete security audit on it, then my employers Synergy Learning, or any of the other Moodle Partners listed at http://moodle.com would be, I'm sure, happy to quote a price for doing so. As already stated, Moodle still uses SHA1 in the source code (in places where it is not a security risk of any kind) - but if you are specifically asking about password hashing, then a quick search in Moodle tracker brought up this ticket: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-35332 which suggests that md5 hashing for passwords was removed in Moodle 2.5.
Comment 10: Worth linking to the source of the password hashing function: https://github.com/moodle/moodle/blob/master/lib/moodlelib.php#L4425 and you can also use GitHub features to view the changes over time. I dislike the fact that a 'fasthash' option exists here. I had typed out a breakdown of why I think this - but I've removed it for now in favour of creating a tracker item.
Comment 11: The use of the algorithms is for hashing, not encryption (though the two may seem similar). This means the resultant hash is compared with a password to see if there is a match when the hashing algorithm is run. This means that the actual password is not stored on the system. If an attacker has access to the user hashes in the database you probably have bigger problems than the strength of the hashing algorithm because they would normally have access to all your data "in the clear". Of course you would still want the best hash algorithm you could have. Recent versions of Moodle have a system for adding "salts" to hashes which makes them much harder to break as a result. I have spent many hours attempting to break standard unsalted hashes with multi gigabyte rainbow tables and given a non dictionary password I have never managed to break in (and that was either Moodle 2.7 or earlier, so it would have got more difficult since. Moodle uses hashing for storing file names, but this has nothing to do with security. In relation to Davo's comment the password_hash function accepts a parameter to indicate what algorithm is used and I believe this will depend on the version of PHP being used, you can read about that here https://docs.moodle.org/30/en/Password_salting Security is a very complex business.

Post title: CSS file parsing in modules
Post description: I have several files being included as part of a module (they are not named styles. css ), but the background-image: url('[[pix:blah]]') part isn't being parsed into a proper URL . Am I doing something wrong? Or do I HAVE to put all the CSS into a styles.css file?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You should be putting all your CSS into the styles.css file, that way it can be cached as a single file that is sent to the user's browser (and then stored there for 24 hours, without needing to be sent from the server again). This will also solve the problem of the [[pix:blah]] part not being parsed.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle Course Inherite
Post description: Hey Guys - We have a question about the architecture of one of our solutions based on Moodle. We need to have a parent course and inherited the content from the Master Course to all it's children. The requirement is to create hundreds of courses based on the parent course, When a content changed in the master course - the content needs to be changed in it's child course. But - when content added to the child courses, the content needs to live forever. Is there any extension or way to build this kind of solution based on Moodle features? We have expert developers in-house - and we can develop this kind of solution ourselves - what will be the best way to approach it - from architecture perspective?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The initial cloning should not be a problem. I would suggest to use backup and restore mechanisms (that can be scripted) to clone the master course to many clones. What I think will be challenging is the replication of changes in the master course. I guess some events driven system could be appropriate but that's just guessing.
Comment 2: Hey David, Thanks for your reply, that's what we had in our mind too - we are working with several projects based on Moodle, and this feature looks like a needed one for each of them, If we find elegant solution - I hope we can share it with the community, Thanks, Roi Shillo

Forum Post: 
Post title: Announcement: ER diagram for the competency tables
Post description: As part of my ongoing project to create ER (Entity Relationships) diagrams for Moodle I have been working on enhancing the tool I use to generate the SQL that I reverse engineer into the diagram. The latest feature is to allow me to create some XML that stores "inferred relationships", i.e. tables/columns that look like they should have primary/foreign key relationships (PK/FK) but where that data is not in the Moodle table source code. The first fruit of this is a diagram that I believe to show the relationships between the tables in the competencies module delivered for Moodle 3.1. You can see a first attempt at this at http://www.examulator.com/er/3.1/components/competency.png and http://www.examulator.com/er/3.1/components/competency.pdf (same diagram different format). Note that if the image appears fuzzy, click your mouse and it will come into focus. I intend to produce a diagram for 3.1 in the same way as I have for previous versions of Moodle (see the 3.0 diagram here http://www.examulator.com/er/ ) and will work through each of the sub components as seen here http://www.examulator.com/er/components/index.html The code that generates the SQL and manages the additional relationships can be found here https://github.com/marcusgreen/moodle_local-sqlgenerator All feedback greatly appreciated.

Post title: moodle form elements auto posting back, getting value
Post description: I'm working on a settings page for my Block. What's the correct, moodle y way that I can use a moodle form element (e.g. select) to automatically post back, without validation, and then be able to pick up the value of that form element? Say I have a drop down with 5 elements, and I not only want to capture the value of that dropdown, but also change the display of the next element in the form based on what is selected in the drop down. The course edit form does this with its format dropdown, but it also works somewhat differently to how a block settings form is built so the comparison isn't completely analogous. 
```text
$contexts = array('system' => 'System', 'category' => 'Category', 'course' => 'Course', 'group' => 'Group', 'user' => 'User');


$attribs = array('onchange' => 'document.querySelector("#id_updatecontext").click()');


$mform->addElement('select', '
context
', 'select context', $contexts, $attribs);


$mform->setDefault('context', 'System');


$mform->registerNoSubmitButton('updatecontext');


$mform->addElement('submit', 'updatecontext', 'update context'); // get_string('updatecontext','block_doclib')


$PAGE->requires->js_init_call('document.querySelector("#id_updatecontext").style.display="none";', null, true);
```
 When the 'context' select postback occurs, I'd like to then perform some kind of switch statement in php to redraw the rest of the form. (switch postback_value) - when "system", draw a set of form element; when "category" draw a different set of form elements, etc. Do I just use a $_POST variable? I haven't seen that used elsewhere in the same way in Moodle.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello Tim, Maybe this post can help you... https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=347936 Best regards, Iban Cardona.

Post description: How to add These html files to my moodle site with back end. Is there any plugin for course recommendation to students or employee from manager. Please tell me how to write the back end code for these files.It means i want retrieve data from database to these fields. Please Download and check.And please give me the reply. is there any plugin like this. (Edited by Mary Cooch to remove poster's email address - original submission Tuesday, 21 July 2015, 9:51 AM)
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Course recommendation system (to students or employee from manager)? You can use Moodle core modules like: Database . According to your mini site, I think the Feedback mod can do it as well. Or you can use the plugin: https://moodle.org/plugins/view/block_cmanager . If you are using Moodle, you don't need any other 'Backend site' at all.
Comment 2: Hi Thanks for your replay.But i want to add extra pages for moodle website with my static pages design.i already attached the files with this.So is there any possibility to add this files to over website with dynamically.Because  i want retrieve data from database.
Comment 3: I think you have two options 1 rewrite your pages as a plugin within the moodle site 2 use web services to link to moodle to get the details you want and pass them to your mini-site I don't think external pages are able to simply access the information in the moodle database as that would be a significant security risk
Comment 4: If you DO want to display your mini site inside Moodle, that is easy, check this: https://docs.moodle.org/26/en/File_resource_settings#Displaying_a_website_index_page
Comment 5: I don't think a mini-site like that can access data direct from the database without something like web-services though can it William?
Comment 6: You are right Richard, the mini site just is a quick and easy way to display a Web site as a Moodle resources. No any data exchange.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Call Web API using soap in moodle
Post description: Hi, I want to call moodle web api using soap. My url is /webservice/soap/ server .php?wsdl=1&wstoken=dfdfg&wsfunction=core_user_get_users&criteria[0][key]=email&criteria[0][value]=abc@moodle.com. But it gives the error 'The web service description parameter named 'grades' is an single or multiple structure. It can not be set as VALUE_OPTIONAL. Check web service description'. Please help and reply as soon as possible. Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I'm guessing here... The error message says: 'The web service description parameter named 'grades' is an single or multiple structure. It can not be set as VALUE_OPTIONAL." So "grades" is a required option in your web service but your url does not contain the expected "grades" parameter: 
```text
/webservice/soap/
server
.php?wsdl=1&wstoken=dfdfg&wsfunction=core_user_get_users&criteria[0][key]=email&criteria[0][value]=abc@moodle.com
```
 What happens when you change the web service code so that it includes the "grades" parameter in that url like this? 
```text
/webservice/soap/
server
.php?wsdl=1&wstoken=dfdfg&wsfunction=core_user_get_users&criteria[0][key]=email&criteria[0][value]=abc@moodle.com&grades=something
```
Comment 2: Thanks for your reply. I tried and add grades in the url but it gives same error.
Comment 3: I read that wsdl is not currently compatible with java or .net. In future, will wsdl compatible with java or .net?
Comment 4: No, apparently Moodle doesn't generate a valid WSDL but you can use SOAP ( https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=340326#p1371932 ).

Post title: change data of a table with the selection of  radio buttons in moodle 2.9.3
Post description: Hi, I have two radio buttons in a page. I need to populate a table in the same page,  with respect to the selection of these radio buttons. I am using moodle 2.9.3. Anyone please help me. I am new in moodle. So i havn't  a clear idea about how to implement it.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Are you looking to do this using Javascript (i.e. you select a radio button and the table changes on the page), or just with PHP (you select a radio button, submit the form, it reloads teh page with a different table)? If you're just using PHP, you want to look at the formslib documentation on how to create and handle forms in Moodle.  You might also want to look at the methods for outputting tables, which you can do using Templates (recommended if you're on Moodle >= 2.9) or Output Components . If you want to use Javascript as well, you'll need to know how to use jQuery to detect the radio button being selected, make an AJAX request to send the selected value to a PHP script, and display the new table.  You'll then need to create a Javascript module containing the Javascript, and a PHP script for it to call which either returns the data for the table, or the HTML for the table itself.

Forum Post: Post title: Help leveraging Moodle templates Post description: I think templates are a fantastic tool for developers, and I'm psyched to start incorporating them everywhere.  However, there are a few hiccups that the documentation doesn't cover.  I'm hoping someone can guide me through the following questions: 1. How exactly does the templatable interface work (how to use the export_for_template method) ?  Can someone provide a clear, from beginning-to-end example? 2. Javascript re-rendering of templates.  Does this work with blocks, or only on pages.  I cannot get this to work with either.  How does the core/templates AMD module know which area to refresh?  Specifically, I'm looking to trigger an ajax call with a button, and have the html within the BLOCK re-render with new data.  Is this possible?  Or does it only work with the main page (the entire page would be reloaded, and I can't control the div/template that gets re-rendered) ? ANY help here would be super appreciated, I've been at this for a while and can't get past these issues. Thanks! Comments associated with the post: Comment 1: Hi Jacek, the "hello world" example for templates would be something like this: ```text class some_class implements \templatable { public function export_for_template(\renderer_base $output) { return ['name' => 'world']; } } ``` and in templates/hello.mustache ```text

hello, {name}

``` The export_from_template() method is just to let you make data from your class available as a simple data structure. For example, if your class has some property that is only available through a getter method (get_something()), you'd call that method in export_from_template() to get the property value. For your other question about Javascript, core/templates will just render the template to a string - you need to explicitly add it to your page. The example code at https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Templates#How_do_I_call_a_template_from_javascript.3F doesn't show this, but you'd be looking to do something like this inside the promise.done callback (with jquery as a dependency): ```text $('#mydiv').html(source); ``` Hope this helps. Comment 2: Thank you much Michael, I'm going to go try later on today - Appreciate your answer!! Comment 3: So no go on the Javascript part.  The "done" method never gets called, neither does the fail method.  When inspecting the packets, the response is something along the lines of: Warning:  Cannot modify header information - headers already sent in Unknown on line 0
[{"error":false,"data":"[ MY ACTUAL MUSTACHE TEMPLATE CODE WITH NO VARIABLES SUBSITUTED] Any ideas on what is going on here? Comment 4: Sorry, I've never seen that before. I'm surprised neither callback is being called when you are getting a response back, so that's probably where to look. Label:

```text
SELECT
ma.course "course id",
mcc.name,
mcc.parent,
c.shortname "course",
c.category,
ma.name "assignment Name"

FROM mdl_course c
join mdl_course_categories mcc on mcc.id = c.category
join mdl_course_modules mcm on c.id = mcm.course
join mdl_modules mm on mm.id = mcm.module
join mdl_assign ma on mcm.instance = ma.id

WHERE c.shortname LIKE '%ACC%'
AND mm.name = 'assign' 
AND ma.name = 'ACC 201 Assessment'
ORDER by c.category
```

Post title: Adding URL foreach courses
Post description: Hey, I want to create a simple button "Virtual Class" in each courses of Moodle which redirect to a URL . Have you got some tutorial or example for this ? I'm new to Moodle, Thank you Ben.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Do you just need the same link appearing on every course, or a different link for each? If you need the same one on every course, you could create an HTML Block which appears on every course.  You'll want to read up on Managing Blocks and Block Settings for how to do that. If you want a different link on each course, you can create an instance of the URL module on each course with the corresponding link.  In either case, there's no development required.
Comment 2: Hey, thank you for your answer, I need a new link everytime I click on the button, here is my mind in PHP : 1) Get all courses : $courses = get_courses('all'); 2) Variable random : $randomnumber = rand(); 3) For each course I create a button to link to my VPS (using Jitsi-meet btw )  : echo " <form method="link" action="https://URL_TO_MY_VPS/'$randomnumber'"> <input type="submit" value="Click here for virtual classroom"></form>;"> What do you think ? Thank you very much, Ben
Comment 3: Do you want the URL to unique for each course? What you're suggesting will first off give you unpredictable numbers, and secondly could generate the same number for 2 different courses. You could just use the $course->id or $course->shortname as the name of the Jitsi room, that way you know it will be unique with the added bonus that you can easily tell which room is for which course. I'd say you could still use the URL module for this as it allows you to append course variables to the specified URL, but unfortunately it doesn't support doing that with clean URLs at the moment (only ?foo=bar form, which doesn't look like Jitsi Meet will accept). You could write a simple block to do this, which creates the link based on the course page it's displayed on. If you make the Jitsi server name configurable, I'd imagine it could be useful to other members of the community too. If you have a read through that tutorial, inside the get_content() method you can do $this->page->course to get the current course, then use $OUTPUT->single_button(); to create the button (or use a template if you want to do things properly). As an aside, "link" isn't actually a valid value for a form's method attribute . In this case you want "get".
Comment 4: Hello, I'm looking at old forums on how to integrate Jitsi meet and moodle, the general idea is that when someone would like to have a tutorial with a teacher, just select the calendar day and send that information to jitsi. But I do not know if there is a plugin that they already do it, or if I have to do the integration by myself. If anyone of you has information on how to do this integration I would really appreciate it. I hope someone read this hehehe

Forum Post: 
Post title: New ER diagram for Moodle 2.8 database structure available
Post description: I have released a version of the Moodle database entity relationship (ER) diagram generated from the Moodle 2.9 code which can be found at http://www.examulator.com/er Although the tables in core Moodle do not change a much between releases this diagram is a little more ambitious than the previous ones. It incorporates relationships missing from the release code which can be found in this bug report https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-49795 Also the SQL code that was used to reverse engineer the diagram included field comments. When Moodle is installed it will normally throw away all field level comments. I updated the code so it kept the comments. Due to some quirks the comments may be truncated but I decided some information is better than none. This diagram is probably most helpful if you download the *.mwb file and load it up in MySQL workbench (a free cross platform tool) but I hope the graphics/png files are also useful. Check out the component diagrams as well at http://www.examulator.com/er/components/index.html
