Forum Post: 
Post title: jquery within label
Post description: Hi, I'm struggling to find a way to make a simple jquery call from within a label on Moodle 3.3 (using Boost theme). Any attempt to reference jquery via '$' or 'jquery' returns undefined. Could someone point me in the right direction? regards, Cathal.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Moodle loads Javascript (including jQuery) using AMD modules via RequireJS.  This means that jQuery isn't available within the global namespace, only when you require it in another AMD module. The developer wiki has a page introducing how to write Javascript modules in Moodle , including an example using jQuery.

Forum Post: 
Post title: API method to add moodle default help-button (tooltip)
Post description: Hello, is there an API way of adding a help-button to an arbitrary position like you do to forms with $mform->addHelpButton(...)? In my module there is a custom button getting rendered in the cm_info_view method. I'd love to have a default Moodle help-button next to it. best regards
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I found out, that it's probably done like this: require_login($courseid); $helpicon = new help_icon('langref', 'mymodulename'); echo $OUTPUT->render($helpicon); It does work, but is it the correct way of doing this? Or is this deprecated?
Comment 2: That is valid. You can also use just 
```text
echo $OUTPUT->help_icon('stringid', 'plugintype_pluginname');
```
 given that your plugin provides strings `stringid` and `stringid_help` . You can also use 
```text
echo $OUTPUT->heading_with_help(...);
```
 All these are defined in the `core_renderer` class in the lib/outputrenderers.php file.

Post description: I've been asked to ensure we have records of all users accepting our revised AUP but have a problem with how Moodle is handling redirections in our scenario, was wondering if anyone has any ideas... users are on LDAP auth i.e. no SSO when they open the site user needs to click a shortcut on a PC desktop to open up Moodle and accept the AUP if not logged in they need to be prompted to sign in after login they get redirected to either a URL that triggers the policy acceptance or to My Moodle (which also seems to trigger it) The problems we have are: auto-login of guests is enabled therefore I can't link to http://siteurl/my as it won't trigger a login box preventing access to My Moodle for Guests only redirects to the home page so no good there either linking directly to http://siteurl/user/policy.php just redirects to the home page due to the auto-login as Guest customising either login/index.php or /my/index.php doesn't seem to work if I try a redirect in the code (goes off to home page rather than going back to the page that was launched before the login attempt) The Site Policy behaviour also seems to be different to how I recall it in the past; I thought in older versions you couldn't view any part of the site until the Policy had been accepted but now this only seems to happen when the user tries to access a course page i.e. Front Page and My Moodle can be viewed without accepting the terms? Seems like there should be a way to achieve the behaviour I need but probably needs some custom code, any ideas would be much appreciated to save me tearing my hair out (!)

Forum Post: 
Post title: Send request with data from external server to Moodle
Post description: Hi dear community, is it possible to send POST request from external server to Moodle and then, already in Moodle, doing some actions with data and save to DB(DB table created by local plugin). Have any possibilities to do that? Thanks all for help.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Well, that would constitute a Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack, and Moodle has protections in place to prevent that kind of thing from being successful. A better approach would be to look for an existing web service in Moodle to achieve what you want, or develop your own custom web service.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Course availability depending on the network
Post description: Hello, The company where I'm working at have a learning environment, which runs a moodle install (they are currently using version 2.4). There are a lot of courses there, and every employee can enroll into them. This environment is available both through the intranet and the Internet (or the extranet, as we call the external access here). Now, they want to restrict access to some courses when the access comes through the extranet. That is, a worker can access moodle from home, but not every course will be available for him, even if he is already enrolled in it. Altough, if he is connected through the intranet, every course will be available. For courses available both from extranet and intranet, the workers' progress should be kept sincronized, preferably by using the same database . I can't find a way to do such thing, so I need you to point me in the right direction. Is there a way to do this kind of control (at course level) through a plugin? Or will I have to do any change on moodle core files? Kind Regards, Matheus Berlesi
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I am not aware of a plugin that would provide such functionality. Some custom enrolment plugin would be needed. Basically, it would check the IP of the browser and if it does not fit the configured range for the intranet IPs, it would not allow the user to access the course. Alternative solution could be to use Apache to control this. It's surely suboptimal solution as there are many URLs that lead to activities and contents within the course. What I mean is something like (not valid syntax, just the idea should be clear) 
```text
RewriteEngine On
RewriteCond %{REMOTE_ADDR} ... (is not in intranet range)
RewriteRule ^(/course/view.php?id=xxx*)$ / (then redirect to somewhere)
```
Comment 2: Hey David, I think controlling this through Apache would be very dificult, because some courses should be accessible both through intranet and extranet. So we would have to keep a list of the extranet-available course ids in the .htaccess file, and this list may change at any time (e.g.: when a new course is created). Also, a logged user would still see the unavailable courses in the list of courses when accessing through extranet, but this is a minor problem. Your first solution is more likely what I was trying to achieve, except that even if the user is already enrolled in an intranet-only course, the plugin shouldn't allow the user to see the course (or at least do any activity/see the course content), and even if the user is outside the intranet, there are courses that should be accessible.
Comment 3: Seems counter to usual use of e-learning, but if you have a real need to prevent people doing courses in their own time... I can imagine a hack that does not mess with core moodle. However it would not prevent them accessing the course from external access once enrolled in a course. I suppose that courses that were to be completed in under a day could kick them out once completed after they accessed/ enrolled in the intranet only course. Honestly I have not thought so much about that part. Put the 'Intranet only' courses in a hidden category in moodle called maybe Main Office. Link to the courses from a page on an intranet only server , or within a non-moodle folder on the moodle server that only permits access within the intranet ip range and subnet. Put a Link in a html block in moodle to access Intranet only courses, which opens a page with these links in - doesn't load when outside intranet. A more technical fix would be a php block that displays links for the courses inside the intranet and "contact HR for details of further courses available at the main office" when not inside the intranet based on ip address of user.

Forum Post: 
Post title: how to change the module instances' names
Post description: Hello, In my website, there are several modules (forum, chat, wiki). I want to change the module instances' names. I found the tables in the db: mdl_forum, mdl_chat and mdl_wiki and I modified the attribute "name". But when I refresh the page http://localhost/moodle/course/view.php?id=2, the module names are still the old one. I clean the browser cache, the problem is still at there. Someone knows how to solve it? Thank you
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You need to call the Moodle function rebuild_course_cache(). This can be done for a single course (rebuild_course_cache($courseid)) or for all courses on the site (leave out the courseid parameter). Alternatively, for Moodle 2.5 (or below), you can clear the 'modinfo' and 'sectioncache' fields in mdl_course. For Moodle 2.6 (or above), you could try purging all caches (site admin > developer > purge all caches).

Post title: How to create new file area for course
Post description: Hi, I want create new file area in course like summary ,so that we can insert and retrieve image from that file area.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Not exactly what you've asked. Still worth looking at: http://docs.moodle.org/en/File_system_repository
Comment 2: Hi Visvanath, Thank you for your reply , but my problem statement is not to create file repository. I have create a form and add element for editor using mform->add_element and using that want to save image in new_area. Like in course editor save image in summary area. So how i will create that area?
Comment 3: I think the answer really depends on exactly how / where you want the form to appear to edit the image and how/where you want the image to be displayed. Creating a file area, really is just a case of choosing a name for the file area. However, that won't give you a form for editing it, or a way of displaying it. All file areas need 4 bits of information: A contextid (which could be the course context , the activity context, the block context) A component name (could be 'core' or the name of the activity that manages the files, basically, this is the name of the plugin that Moodle will call back to, to retrieve the file for the user) A filearea name (your plugin can choose this however it wants) (Optionally) an item ID (if there are multiple file areas with the same filearea name - e.g. multiple forum posts, with different itemids, but the same file area 'attachment')
Comment 4: Hi Davo , I know the moodle function to save data from editor and display image using editor as follow file_postupdate_standard_editor($data, ' textfield ', $editoroptions, $course_context, ' course ', ' summary ', 0); Instate of i want to save in 'myarea' in course it save. file_postupdate_standard_editor($data, ' textfield ', $editoroptions, $course_context, ' course ', ' myarea ', 0); I have successfully able to save image against myarea but when try to display the image using follow image not display. $text = file_rewrite_pluginfile_urls($editor_img->course_image, 'pluginfile.php',$course_context->id, ' course ', ' myarea ', null); $description = format_text($text, 1, $options);
Comment 5: You've shown the code for generating the URL , but have you also updated the code which serves the file back to the user when their browser requests a file via pluginfile.php? For security purposes, every file request is processed via the plugin in the 'component' part of the URL, so that Moodle can confirm that the user should have access to that file. In the case of the 'course' component, this is handled in the 'file_pluginfile' function in lib/filelib.php (around line 4314, in the Moodle 2.6 site I have open in front of me). You will need to update this code, to let Moodle know that 'myarea' is a valid area for saving files (but I'm still not clear what you are trying to achieve by saving the files from the text editor into a new location).
Comment 6: Hi Davo, Thank you for your reply, its working for me. There is requirement in our project to insert multiple image in our custom form and insert that in our custom table. Thank You.
